review_content: Old Untappd checkin, June 26, 2016. Brown glass bottle. Unremarkable aroma. Sweet malt flavor, crisp finish. Solid, easy drinking lager.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso viene attratto dall'orzo. La finezza olfattiva è un timido profumo e la maniera in cui permane è corta. Il manto birroso superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma che resiste abbastanza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido si presenta trasparente. Il colore è giallo dorato. Il corpo è medio. L'amaro è moderato. La forza gustativa è normale e permane in maniera appena percepibile. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di facile beva. Il retrogusto è delicato. L'aroma in bocca porta i segni di miele, cereali ed erbaceo.
Golden color, excellent foam. There is a lot of metal in the aroma, in the malt taste and there is some kind of fruity note. Pilsner is not here, a typical Euro lager.
*rating overgezet* Fles op vakantie geprobeerd in Duitsland. Het is een helder goudgeel bier met een wit schuim. Het heeft een moutige wat grassige geur. De smaak is moutig en zacht zoet.

Bottle from Go Asia in Hamburg - deep golden color, clear, small white head. taste is grainy malty, medium sweet. not bitter at all. very quick to down, no fuzz here. super uninspired, but no flaws either. standard okay macro lager.
Nudne, ale też nie spieprzone. Pijalne, bo smaku nie za dużo, przynajmniej piana fajna.
When it’s a hot as fuck day in Bali and your wanting a change up from Bintang, this actually goes alright. Crisp Pilsner style lager that served ice cold will go down like water.

Color naranja, sin turbiedad, transparente. Espuma blanca de medio dedo de espesor y exactamente un segundo de retención. Aroma escaso a cereal, heno y hierba levemente podrida. Sabor a cereal, dulzor desagradable, final corto, dulzón, con posgusto metálico, alcohol imperceptible. Textura acuosa. Carbonatación media.

Un total y absoluto despropósito.
33cl bottle, consumed from the bottle... so whatever.  WHOOOO, skunky off the top, malt and grass and garbage.  Flavor is grassy, skunky, celery.  Finishes dry.  Yeah, bad.

Beer Number From Brewery: 1

Container Type: Bottle - 330ml

Date Drank: 7 January 2020

Purchase Location: Dan Murphy's
 
Aroma: Straw, earthy

Appearance: Light amber with a decent head
 
Flavour: Not a lot of bitterness, strangely malty

Mouthfeel: Thin
 
Comments: An okay beer for a hot summers day but that's about it
11.2 oz bottle. Smells of corn. Crisp and clear dark yellow color. Tastes like your average pils. Taste of corn and some residual sweetness. Crisp finish with a slight sweetness. An OK pils.

Thanks yantarcoast for the tip where to find it. Clear pale yellow, large airy white head of mediocre retention. Aroma: pilsner malt, walnut, a hint of alcohol. Light to medium body. Average carbonation. Taste: sweetish malts, restraint fruitiness. Low bitterness. I'll hardly remember the beer but I'll do remember the country tick.

From a can to a glass. Pours a clear yellow or very light gold color with a frothy foamy head. Aroma is Corn malt and slight bready note. Taste follows the aroma with a slight earthy hop note. Medium light mouthfeel. Average Pilsner.

12 oz bottle. Pours a bright gold with a thin white head gone immediately. Scents of malt and biscuit. Dry malt flavor with some metallic hops notes to mimic pilsner imperfectly. Drinkable but roughly made.
05.10.2019 -- 0.32l bottle from asia shop in freiburg. pours s clear pale golden with a frothy head. aroma of corn, lemon, cereals. flavour of lemon, lemondrops, corn, some zest. drinkable actually.
Old Untappd checkin, June 26, 2016. Brown glass bottle. Unremarkable aroma. Sweet malt flavor, crisp finish. Solid, easy drinking lager.

Bottle from Go Asia in Hamburg - deep golden color, clear, small white head. taste is grainy malty, medium sweet. not bitter at all. very quick to down, no fuzz here. super uninspired, but no flaws either. standard okay macro lager.
Nudne, ale też nie spieprzone. Pijalne, bo smaku nie za dużo, przynajmniej piana fajna.
When it’s a hot as fuck day in Bali and your wanting a change up from Bintang, this actually goes alright. Crisp Pilsner style lager that served ice cold will go down like water.

33cl bottle, consumed from the bottle... so whatever.  WHOOOO, skunky off the top, malt and grass and garbage.  Flavor is grassy, skunky, celery.  Finishes dry.  Yeah, bad.

Thanks yantarcoast for the tip where to find it. Clear pale yellow, large airy white head of mediocre retention. Aroma: pilsner malt, walnut, a hint of alcohol. Light to medium body. Average carbonation. Taste: sweetish malts, restraint fruitiness. Low bitterness.…

From a can to a glass. Pours a clear yellow or very light gold color with a frothy foamy head. Aroma is Corn malt and slight bready note. Taste follows the aroma with a slight earthy hop note. Medium light mouthfeel. Average Pilsner.

12 oz bottle. Pours a bright gold with a thin white head gone immediately. Scents of malt and biscuit. Dry malt flavor with some metallic hops notes to mimic pilsner imperfectly. Drinkable but roughly made.
05.10.2019 -- 0.32l bottle from asia shop in freiburg. pours s clear pale golden with a frothy head. aroma of corn, lemon, cereals. flavour of lemon, lemondrops, corn, some zest. drinkable actually.
La bière de vacances parfaite ! Sans prétention et plus goutue que l'originale espagnole !

This beer has to be consumed ice cold. When it is it is up there with the best of them. But unfortunately in the harsh tropical sun that is the Philippines it can be quiet a challenge. But at my house I keep them very cold but you just need to drink em quick as if they get slightly above chilled it gets ugly pretty quick.

pale yellow colour, medium sized, quickly disappearing white head; aroma of green apple, some citruy-lemongrassy, as well as herbal notes; taste is the same with some definite unpleasant rotten notes...I'm not amazed at all
330ml bottle.  Pours bright gold with a medium head.  Aroma is sweetand soapy corn and cardboard.  Taste is sweet, with lots of corn and cardboard.  Sharp carbonation.  Pretty poor.
Burk 330 ml från 7Eleven i Thailand. Guldgul med skum som sedan lägger sig. Doft av malt och frukt. Smak av malt, bröd, majs, metall och citrus. Väldigt söt med begränsad beska.
Děkuji @suen za vzorek. Lahvove sdilene 0.33l dovezené z Hong Kongu........
Clean. Amber color. Moderate hop bitterness. moderately medium to high carbonation. white head quickly vanish.
Wyraźnie słodowy smak, nawet w miarę intensywny, lekko wyczuwalny chmiel. Przyzwoite

This is a beer meant to be had one after another in the tropical heat of the Philippines with local foods.

Its lightly sweet flavor is meant to contrast with the ever present sour and salty flavors of vinegar, soy, and the local citrus fruit called calamansi.

It pairs well with food and the light 5% ABV makes it a perfect beer for hours of social drinking done here.
A gold colored pilsner with a head that dissappears fairly quickly. Clean but mildly flavored taste. Moderately malty. Has a notably bitter after taste. Very carbonated.

A: Clear gold with a small white head. 
N: Faint hint of pale malt
T: Faint malty profile with a hint of bitterness. Quite a bit of residual sweetness.
P: Thin
O: Standard light lager, but with that sweet note.
Very light golden appearance, high carbonation, fluffy white head, sweetish malty aroma, weak bittery taste and disappears quickly
0,33 l bottle. Nothing special, common beer but in the hot weather condition and served cool is ok

Pálido pilsner en la etiqueta, y lager pálido en estilo, 5% abv. y una botella marcada en relieve.
Cebada malteada importada y cebada sin maltear, lúpulos alemanes y americanos.
Color dorado afirmado, con marcado brillo.

Have been curious to try this for a while....Finally did....Yay!  Chalk it up as a review. Nothing really going on here.   Drinkable I guess, and hard to mess up a pilsner.  Flavor is ok (watery, slightly grassy/grainy/corny, and lightly hoppy finish), decent mouthfeel....so overall a bit below average.  Barely a 5 on the flavor, but figured 4 may be a tad too low.  Grew on me towards the end so not quite as bad as expected.

Average beer. Also known as San Miguel Beer and San Miguel Draft. Imported to the US as San Miguel Premium Lager until some time between 2006 & 2008. San Miguel Pale Pilsen, a pilsner popularly called San Miguel Beer, is the Company’s flagship brand and the Philippines’ leading brew. It is one of the world’s largest selling beers. Made from imported barley malt, as well as German and American hops, it is exported to over 40 countries worldwide.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fles 64cl bij Green House in Bangkok. Maltig zoet, ver weg hoptoontjes, granig, wat maïs. Malten overheersen. (10-12-2018).

Pale pilsner à l'étiquette, et pale lager en style, de 5 % abv.
A noter la contenance assez particulière de 32 cl … le robinet était court,
et une bouteille marquée en relief " property of San Miguel brewery " ..
on n'est jamais trop prudent !!
Orge malté importé et orge non malté, houblons allemands et américains (??).
Mon exemplaire était à 3 mois avant sa date.
Couleur doré affirmé, à la brillance marquée.
Bulles fines, en fontaine virevoltante.
Mousse blanche, en nappage de surface, entretenu par les bulles.
Arômes de poireau, haricots blancs, genièvre.
1ère bouche sur blanc de poireau, ciboulette, câpres.
Arrière-bouche qui crée un sursaut à l'estomac.
2ème qui fait le voyage entre le chou-fleur et la sauce au sésame.
Arrière-bouche avec plus d'ail que de sésame.
Longueur effarante.
Alcool nul.
Finale effrayante.
CONCLUSION : cette pale lager et aussi pale pilsner est en définitive 
une … comment dire .. pâle mixture !! (je suis gentil)
NB Je vois à l'instant sur l'étiquette " expertly brewed since 1890 " .. 
Là je me roule par terre !! (rendez-vous en 2090 ...)

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

Not a terrible PL, some restrained grassyhop notes and grainy-slighy rusty elements balance out a sligthly watery but quite quaffable brew. (Shame that RB recognizes the Hong Kong-brewed version as from the Philippines though) (11.2 oz can, Tallinn)
Ein unspektakuläres, einfaches Lagerbier, das in Richtung Strandbiere geht, die in der Gegend ja recht beliebt sind. Kann man trinken- muss man aber nicht getrunken haben.

Bottle.

A- Grains, corn.

A- Yellow color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Corn, slightly sweet, grains.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Sometimes you just have to admit that a pale lager hits the spot. Even a shitty one. After a hot day of housework and a salty supper, this brew was a nice crisp way to round things out. By the end of the bottle it had that same old bland lager taste and feel for for a while, it was nice and cold and refreshing.
Tasted on 08.02.16. Unpleasant malty aroma. Unpleasant malty taste with noticeable bitterness.

Bottle served into pilsner glass. A 1" sudsy white head falls slowly with some mild lacing. Color is clear light gold with carbonation slowly streaming upward. Aroma malty grain, grassy hops and a bit of citrus. Mouthfeel is light and a lingering, slightly astringent finish. Flavor of light toasted bread, biscuit, with mild grassy hops. Overall it a decent lager, but nothing outstanding.

New country tick, woot. 2.75 bottle from Parkhurst Wine Shop at Rainbow Hill. Pours clear golden with an inch of frothy white head. Aroma is cornmeal, copper, grass. Flavor is grasses, wet corn chips, light floral notes (very light). Not offensive, but not good. Light bodied, somewhat flat. Hey, at least it's another country off my list.

Pours clear yellow, big white head. Aroma is bready apple corn, typical of the style. Taste is bread, light indistinct hops, typical corn apple tang, nothing special, one more bland version of the style.

Pale golden colour. Light mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation. Nothing outstanding, though slightly better than most mainstream beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Purchased a six pack of cans from my local $0.99 store. Thick white head, on top of a clear yellow body.  It has the aroma of dry grains, like wheat. It has a clean, crisp taste of malt sweetness. But there's kind of an off putting aftertaste.  I think I'll use it as my new base line beer. If it isn't better than this it isn't very good. I'd buy again if it's my cheapest option.

One of the best beer that my Dad was able to gave me a couple of years ago. I agree with my Dad that this beer has an amazing taste that we both love to drink every weekend. A perfect drink to have an ample time spending with friends and family here in Auckland. Mr. Andy Rothmans of Beercellar is the jack of all trades.thanks buddy for given us an extra stocks of this beer for my dad.
Pale golden colour. Light mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation. Nothing outstanding, though slightly better than most mainstream beers.
在農曆新年宴會上的樽裝，聞起來沒有香氣，清澈的金黃色，剛倒出來氣泡強勁，但一殺那后氣泡消失，喝起來一陣奇怪的苦味，沒有麥香，之前喝過生啤，感覺跟樽裝分別不大，不好喝。

Sampled from 0.32 l bottle from a local Asian food store, best before August 2018. Clear, golden with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish, slightly grassy-spicy aroma of grains and some straw. Moderately sweet, slightly bitter, a bit grassy-spicy taste of grains and some straw, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly dry and a bit grassy finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Pretty bland but not bad.

"The beer appears golden in colour with a solid amount of foam. Standard lager taste that dies out seconds after entering the mouth. No aftertaste whatsoever. Tastes dangerously like water." - beersoftheworldproject.wordpress.com

Date: 03/03/2017

Bought at: Sari-Sari Mart in Copenhagen, Denmark.

330ml bottle
Pale gold with slight head.
Sweet, bland with a vague bitterness in there somewhere.
Oy hum.....

330mL bottle into glass at Niños Lamesita, Adelaide.  In a funky bottle and it pours very clear, pale yellow and creates a nice head that doesn't last very long. It has quite a "beery" aroma and a fairly inoffensive flavor. Not as dull as cheap American or Australian lagers but not a high quality beer. It's fun to drink with Filipino food but once you've tried it, there's no need to get it again.
Bottle from Asia shop in Frankfurt. Standard Lager, pretty mediocre, really nothing special. Drinkable, but I don’t see a point in importing it.
330ml bottle into pint glass. Amber beer with frothy white head. Low carbonation. Sweet plasticine nose, some grain. Light taste of toasted grain. Finish is long with a little grain. Drinkable.

320 ml bottle at Regal Airport Hotel, Hong Kong, on October 1, 2017.
Clear pale golden color, white head with lacing. Malty, grainy, clean, sweet scent. Malty, cream, grainy taste. Malty, sweet aftertaste. Medium mouhtfeel, low bitterness.
5/3/6/3/12=2.9
All the panache, flavor and presence of wilted iceberg lettuce on a hot day. A cold swallow refreshes briefly but is then followed by a slightly foul aftertaste. I will never buy this beer again.

One of many, but first time I've rated this. On tap at B.A.T.S., Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta on 19-Sep-2017. Clear golden amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma of sweet crystal malt and grain. Light to medium body and carbonation. Taste of sweet malt, grain, funk and citrus. Lightly hopped and bittersweet.

BB 07 04 18. Poured a perfect crystal clear amber with a one-finger white foamy head that diminished quickly and laced poorly. Aroma sweet with malt and grain and a hint of metal; no obvious hops. Taste of sweet grainy malt with a bit of tartness; no real hops. Light body with a very thin mouthfeel. Crisp and slightly dry with quite a sweet finish that lingers a bit. Another pale lager.

330ml bottle. Pours clear golden, bubbly white head, doesn’t stay. Weak corny, lagery aroma, grainy. Taste of wet paper, grain, butter. Greasy finish. Light bodied, average carbo. Not the worst one, but still..
Bottle in puerto galera, Philippines. The only beer they served me whit ice cubes on it... Filipino style! Common lager
Als Freund von kraftvollen Lagerbieren war ich wirklich überrascht am anderen Ende der Welt ein solches "Lerckerli" gefunden zu haben.
Piano beznadziejna, jak na coli. W zapachu DMS, mokry karton. W smaku tez DMS, słodkawe, lekka goryczka.
Comically large bottle at Shenzhen Bao’an. Bright yellow. Basically zero head. Spicy start but it mellows into overly sweet malt.
Faint, malty aroma. Clear straw colour. Sweet malty front with slight bitter finish. Light body with high carbonation. Fine for casual sipping.

320ml bottle. Clear golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma: sweet pale malts, grainy. Taste: sweet grainy malt, corn. Light bodied, average carbonation. Standard lager, sweeter than it needs to be but at least it’s better than San Mig Light and doesn’t suffer from skunking.
Bottle on Boracay. Zlata farba, bez peny. Vona sladova. Chut sladova, kukuricna, jemne ovocna.

Thick head that dissipates quickly. Pleasant taste, minimal bitterness. This is an underrated beer, and is one of the most requested of all beers when I have friends over. Very easy to drink, and I can say that with confidence (considering how much of San Miguel I have imbibed over the years). There is a reason this is one of the world’s largest selling beers. I plan to drink more of it.

It pours light golden with a white head It has moderate head retention with some lacing. It has grainy sweet aroma with some herbal and grass as well. The flavors are dominate by a malty, grainy sweetness. There are some grassy elements with herbal flavors as well. It has a moderately light body with moderately low bitterness. The aftertaste is grainy sweet. Overall, it is a lager with mostly malty aromas and flavors, but not without some hops that are noticeable.
(Bottle) Aroma of dull tetrahop. Flavour of...nothing. No head to speak of. Finish is bitter and slightly metallic. Well I gave it a try and wasn’t disappointed (since expectations were set low)

330 ml. can in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a clear mid gold. Medium carbonation. Aroma of malt, alcohol, slight sweetness. Taste of malt, grains and sweet acidity. A cheap pilsener but eminently drinkable.

A bottle from Jason’s near NCCU, drunk at home. Aroma: sour, bready. Appearance: clear, pale gold, minimal lacing. Palate: light-bodied, rather thin in texture, average carbonation, noticably bitter finish. Taste: lightly bitter, nothing wrong with it, good beer for the beach.
Clear golden, thick white head. Aroma of sweet malt and corn. Sweet corn and malt flavour, hoppy notes.
Can - Light green apple, corn and some skunk. Clear pale gold with a frothy white head. Light apple and corn with a light finish. A plain watery beer.
From bottle in a shaker. Aroma of malt and faint hops and taste is fairly standard for a PL. Overall a decent lager.
Piwo lepeE niz poprzedniki z tego dnia. Aromat podobny ale smak cos slodowosc czuc. Bardzo slabe puwo lokalnr ale i tak lepsze niz poprzednie

F: big, white, frothy, not long lasting.
C: pale gold, clear.
A: malt, caramel, grassy, grainy.
T: malty, bready, caramel, hint of grassy fresh hops, it imported from Holland and just bottled in Philippines, quite ok, medium body, good carbonation, 33cl bottle from local Philippines food shop Avenue de la Chasse, Brussels.

Bottle : 330 ml. Price : 0,69 eur 

Šaltas "suėjo" visai gerai ... vartotinas.
Yellow golden color with foam ring. Old malt smell, Very sweet corn and rice taste. Unnecessary sweet and malty aftertaste.
06-09-16 // bottle from local Asian supermarket. Clear golden. Malt in nose and mouth. Low carbonation. Flat taste. Boring.
Bottle @ home shared by Thompson. Clear golden color, small white head. Smell and taste malts, rice, lightly grains, lightly bitter in the distance. Low body, low carbonation. Meh.
Bottle shared with benzai... Small white head... Clear golden colour... Smell malts not much else maybe grassy... Taste also malts normal ale.... Nothing special..
Bottle, courtesy of Summer Santa Benzai. Sugary grainy sweet with almost no hops or bitterness. Surprisingly not horrible. But really not much more than a country tick either.
Bottle, thanks Benzai via anstei. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is dusty, sweet grains and corn. Taste is sweet, corny, cereals, rice. Medium carbonation. Not horrible.
33cl stubbi, forget the source. The sweet yet dry corniness prevails, sulphurs and metallics remain manageable. Less offish than a few European competitors in the same league. Exotic amnesiac.

320ml bottle, shared with blackhaddock in his man cave. Many thanks to Erzengel for this! Pours a misty gold, thin white head. Aroma is grains, pale malt. Taste continues with a musty grainy character. Lightly sweet. Rather bland.

320ml bottle, shared with minutemat on 5th Aug 2016. Golden pour with a white topping. Semi-sweet Pils/Lager with nothing to make it stand out from the thousands of similar beers all over the world. Refreshing and thirst quenching but not very inspiring or interesting. Surprised I had never rated it before, cheers Mat for bringing it to my place for our little tasting session.

320mL bottle, courtesy of BuckeyeBoy (thanks man), pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out cheap corn and straw. Flavour is exactly the same: cheap corn and straw with a slightly stale quality. What you’d expect from a Filipino piss lager. Well, it’s a country tick.
Gifted from BuckeyeBoy. 320mL capped bottle poured into hotel glasses. Standard crappy equator lager. Corny and sweet with macro chemically flavors. No hops to speak of. Piss pale yellow color.
Clear yellow with small white head. Aroma is grain, citrus and corn. Taste is metallic, corn and lime.

Tap at the Queen Bee, Bangkok. Poured a crystal clear straw colour with a thin white head. The aroma is lager malt, some light hop. The flavour is moderate to light bitter with a light yeast mineral hop bitter palate. Light bodied with average carbonation.

Sweet little bottle thanks to noel for bring this over for me. Pours out a clear crisp pale straw color topped with a white head. Nose is corn grassy hops and some bread..taste is more of the corn grassy touch of hops.

Poured from cool Belgian style bottle into a willybecher glass, a crystal-clear straw colour with weak white foam. Weak is also the word for its flavour, aroma, mouthfeel, everything. Light body, strong carbonation, weak aftertaste. It’s not offensively bad, per se, just bland.

Can. Light golden, small and mostly diminishing head. Light, malty - lightly grainy and lightly sweetish aroma, light cardboard. Body is light, malty - lightly grainy and lightly sweetish flavor, faint - light metal.Finish is short, malty lightly grainy and lightly sweetish, light metal and cardbord. Watery and sweetish lager with no bitteress for the meek masses - that’s it.

The beer has a simple pilsener look. The color of the beer is golden yellow. The beer is quite clear, but there is a tiny amount of cloudiness in it. The beer pours a normal layer of very rough white foam. The bulk of the foam collapses quickly, but a drape of foam remains in too of the beer. The smell is awful. I smell s simple pilsener aroma, some malts and a tiny fresh hop aroma. This is covers by a dirty bitter and slightly sour aroma of what I think to be rotten ginger. I really don’t like it. The taste is even worse, it is disgusting. It almost makes me throw up. It is a dirty bitter and sour rotten flavor. I am not going to finish it.

32cl (?!) Flasche. Hellgelbes Bier mit festem Schaum. Citrus und Getreide. Süffig herb. Flach im Abgang.

Auch in der Hong Kong Variante!
Bottle at bar. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, a bit of hops, toast, malts and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, a bit of hops, toast and grass. Decent lager.

330 ml can. Recieved in a flight in Hong Kong. Pretty boring golden color low white head. Acid grassy smell with low malts. Pretty metallic bad low flavour taste and with an even more pronunced metalic finish. :(((((
Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy corn aroma. Fruity malty grainy flavor. Has a sweetish malty grainy finish.
Ekstrem tynd pilsner. Inge humle eller sødme. En meget kedelig øl, der ikke er værd at give penge for.

330 mL can.. Appearance: Golden, with a quickly disappearing head. Aroma: cat piss, grains, some solvents. Taste: Some malts, hay and cereals.
Thin and way overcarbonated.

Can 330 mL. Golden colour with quickly disappearing head. Aroma is bad - totally cat piss, some notes of floor cleaning liquid as well. Taste isn’t so bad as aroma gives - some notes of malts, hay, cereals. Very carbonated. I really don’t like the aroma - no thanks!
<Country #88. Pale golden color with a quickly dissapearing white head. Aroma has light cerealish notes. Flavor is slightly sweet with light maltiness. Almost watery final.

Sunday, May 15, 2011	2:00 PM	
Bottle poured to pint glass very cold beer 	
Sight: Light pale yellow, head, a lot of lacing	
Aroma: not a lot, scent smell of malt, nothing else	
Taste: watery, not a lot of taste	
Mouth feel: good carbonation, good follow through, good finish, slightly bitter aftertaste	
Overall: good beer
Surprisingly tasty and much better than the Spanish version of this beer. This one is much more balanced between hops and malt to give a refreshing and crispy taste.
Tasting thuis, fles van mij, gekocht bij Xenos. Beetje kauwgombal chemisch zoet. Backlog from 2015/11/05.
Bottle @ benzai. Clear golden colour with a small white head. Smells malts, corn. Tastes malts, corn, sourish, big mac sauce. Weird and bad. Thin body, soft to medium carbo.
Bottle thanks to a friend. Clear pale yellow with smallish foamy white head, sweetish doughy aroma, high carbonation, somewhat crisp malt taste, abrupt finish. Not too bad for a generic lager.
330ml Flasche. Klar und golden mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Typisches Industrielage mit wenig Geschmack und Aroma.
Butelka. Piwo wypite i wyprodukowane w Hong Kongu ale przez RB zaliczana do Filipin , więc tutaj oceniam. Kolor złoty, typowy lager może trochę poniżej innych lagerów. Na upały.
Pours a clear yellow with a white head that leaves lacing. Nose is faint cereal. Body is light medium. Taste is faint sweetness with hops and slight bitterness. 11.2 oz bottle
Bottle, sampled all over Manila. Light golden yellow. Sweetish. Lacking hop definition. Fairly standard inoffensive hot country lager.
Aroma- cereal, malt, damp hay. Taste- no body, medium sweetness, salty. thin feel, average carbonation, no finish
Poor pale lager . Malt and hay in aroma . Sweet , malty taste with medicine notes. Light bitterness.

How:  Can.  Appearance:  Clear yellow colour beer, with few seconds lasting white head.  Aroma:  malt, cereal.  Taste:  medium sweet, with medium duration.  Palate:  light body, slick texture, very soft carbonation.  Overall:  Pretty good for drinking in large quantities, for sweet taste lovers.
Can, 33 cl. Appearance: golden, sparkling, minimal head. Aroma: cereal, fruits. Taste: cereal, medium sweetness, lightly bitter. light body, medium body, slick feel, lively, fizzy, long finish.

Kolor: jasno ?ó?ty, s?omkowy, czysty, klarowny. Piana koloru bia?ego, do?? obfita i ca?kiem d?ugo pozostaje na powierzchni piwa.
Aromat zaraz po otwarciu butelki pojawi?y si? s?odkawe nuty malinowe, troch? nut s?odowych, mydlanych z odrobin? metalu.

Poured from an 11.2 ounce bottle at Christine’s Casual Dining on Harrison Avenue in Dent. Medium gold hue, aroma graded leniently due to my sinus condition, bittersweet flavor with a slight sour note, a little more heft than a typical US macro. Slightly above average pale lager.

Bottle from Josephine's, a Philippino restaurant in Charlotte Street near the Fitzroy pub. Golden-coloured lager with sweetish malts and very little hop flavour. Not offensive and quite drinkable, but not very memorable.
330ml bottle poured pale gold with a mild aroma of malt grain taste is nothing flash standard macro lager bit fruity malty lightly bitter sweet not too bad
Bottle from Mišo. Thanks! Pours clear light yellow with decent white head. Aroma is malt. Taste is sweet with malt, wort. No sign of hops. Slightly alcoholic finish. Sweet aftertaste.

32cl bottle at home as a gift from Marites, many thanks. Body is clear, fizzy, pale, head is medium, white, fizzy, mostly diminishing, fair lacing. Nose is malty, metallic, flavor is honey, sweet malty, light corn, light tea. Medium to heavy sweet, light bitter, light citric fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting medium sweet, watery side taste. Light body, thin texture, fizzy carbonation. Easy sweet pilsener.

320ml bottle from HMart New Malden, picked up today.  5% BB Nov 2016.  Clear, pale orange, lightly sparkling, small white head doesn’t endure, light lacing.  Aroma is water, a little spearmint, air.  Really not giving much up in the smell.  Body is light, tingly carbonation, foamy.  Taste is vegetal and tangy, dirty water, metallics.  Definite dirt.  Tonic water.  Something acidic or lactic.  Wow.  One of the worst I’ve had.  I almost resent drinking this purely for the Philippines tick.  Almost.
Bottle at home. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is malty, hints of caramel. Taste is medium sweet, malty, bit caramely, bit hoppy.
Bottle at home from an asian supermarket in The Hague, golden beer, small head, aroma is grain, malt, hint of sweetness, taste is the same, actually not bad, quite refreshing to be honest.
Pours a pale yellow. Has a grainy, malt, and pine aroma. A dry taste of grains and malts with some pine. A somewhat refreshing aftertaste, but still a dry feeling on the tongue from the grains.

25 cl on Tap@Oslo Restaurant Tranchere in tulip glass@approx. 6 degrees C. Pours dark golden with small frothy white small head with sufficient retention. Light aroma of bread, malt and caramel. Taste the same including a slight sweetness as of honey or caramel. Very malty with hops narely to be detected though there is a slight bitterness in the aftertaste. Somewhat watery palate and average to high carbonation. Standard fare with no off tastes, but more of a thirst quencher (for which it worked fine on a hot day) than a beer for tasting.
Bottle: It poured a clear golden color with a small white head that quickly dissipated. It has a slight grassy aroma with a malty flavor that is balanced with very little bitterness.
Flesje in restaurant YogYakarta. Pilskleur, weinig kraag. Ruikt metalig, smaakt waterig en metalig, bitterzuur. Slecht bier.
Klares goldgelb mit wenig Schaum. Sehr mild, fast schon wässrig, minimal würzig. Nicht sehr aufregend, dennoch trinkbar.
320ml bottle at Beer Bay, Hong Kong on 2 May. Pours pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of malt and cardboard. Bittersweet finish.
Pours clear golden with a nice white head and a light floral aroma. There is a relatively tasteless carbonated pale malt flavor with a slightly bitter finish.
Classic cheap Asian lager with lot of corn and rice flavour. But not the worst I've had.
330mL bottle pours a clear pale golden with a large white head. Arm pit bready malt and mild grassy hops. Sweet malt with a mild bitterness and finishing watery with paper. Yep, that’s beer.

Some Filipino restaurant in the East Village: Pours pale gold with a white head. Aroma is light bits of grain and sugar. Taste is sweet. Very low hoppiness. Not real off tastes. Pretty refreshing. I can’t complain too much about this.

frothy White small head. fair lacing. fully diminishing. clear thin dark yellow body. aroma: light bread, metal, alcohol, honey, light yeasty. if: moderate sweet (honey). ff: very light bitter and moderate sweet; average duration. palate: metallic finish, lively carbonation, watery texture, light médium body. tastes a little like alcohol. slightly above Brazilian commercial standard. 4s
Aroma: caramel, hay, alcohol. Appearance: pale, clear, minimal head. Taste: light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: light body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter.

This beer pours a clear golden color with a medium white head that did not retain and left very minimal lacing around the glass. The aroma is mild hops, barley malt, and some caramel. The taste is more of the same and the mouth-feel is on the light and watery side.
Aroma: metallic, light, Appearance: golden, clear, white foam, foam disappears fast. Taste: light sweetness, lightly bitter, Palate: light body, thin feel, soft carbonation,

Kolor - złocisty, klarowny. 
Piana - drobniutka, średnio wysoka, średnio trwała. 
Zapach - średni słodowo-chmielowy. 
Smak - średni słód, średni chmiel, lekki kwasek, średnia słodycz, średnia goryczka. 
Poprawne piwo do gaszenia pragnienia.

Served in glass at restaurant: Came light yellow-straw colored with moderate white head. Aroma of malted grain, no hop presence. Taste was grainy sweet, no depth to the flavor. Finish was somewhat dry, slightly bitter. Nothing to write home about.

Beer in Southern Asia is (with the exception of Sri Lanka) crap. This beer is the cheapest you will find in the region, but is pretty undrinkable. Better stick to the Red Horse, made by the same monopoly brewery but with more flavor and a higher ABV, so you won’t have to pour so much crap down your throat to get a buzz.
Drank some bottles in Manilla and Zamboanga in 2010. From what I remember, it was a decent pils, nothing more nothing less.

(San Miguel Pale Pilsen) Stubby bottle 330 ml, served into a glass tankard, ABV 5%
Pale yellow colour on the body, small and frothy white head, with average retention, leaving minimal lacing behind.
Aroma of hay, dried grass, adjuncts -mostly rice-
Taste of rice too, medicinal notes, grains.
Thin body with average carbonation, quite dry on the palate.
Nothing important.
Aroma: caramel, hay, alcohol. Appearance: pale, clear, minimal head. Taste: light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: light body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter.
Not bad for a rice based lager. But, and a big one, make sure you get the Philippines one as San Mig from Hong Kong brewery is awful and from Vietnam tasteless.
Small bottle from a night club on Bangla Road in Phuket. Had this one straight from the bottle, but I can guess what it looks like. Corny aroma, sweet taste. Basic Asian lager, nothing amazing.
0,32 l bottle. Appearance: clear yellow, white foam. Malt aroma, slightly flavored with German hops. Taste light body, watery, malt, something fruity, soft drink for summer.
How: Bottle Appearance: clear yellow, medium white head. Aroma: corn, lemon cest Palate : thin body, high carbonation.

Blonde dorée, mousse blanche sans corps et peu persistante.
Au nez pale lager moyenne.. métallique.
En bouche crispy mais un goût métallique. Quasiment pas d’amertume... 
C’est pas bon.

12 ounce bottle purchased for $1 from sale cart at Nugget in Davis. The aroma has excessive corn and DMS. Some boiled veggies and mild sewage also play a part in the aroma. Transparent, crystal clear yellow body with a small, white head. Starts with a watery, slight metallic flavor. Afterwards, it becomes rather flavorless and watery. Believe it or not, there is a light grassy bitterness late. Pretty unoffensive alcohol delivery device.
strong pale malt aroma. golden and clear with a fast fading head. taste is very watery, very faint malt flavor
Standard beer on the Philippines. Okay in the Philippine heat. Limited aroma and taste.
Tap@Salud. Pale color and white head. Some malt in aroma. Malt and some metal in flavors.
From a can. Pours clear pale amber (surprise), drinkable but that’s about it, and only if there is nothing, and I mean nothing, else.

OK. So this isn’t the greatest beer in the world. It’s also not one of the worst and deserves much better than the 4 overall score above. Not a lot of hops or anything really that noteworthy, but at 26 pesos down at the corner Sari-Sari store ALWAYS, it tastes pretty damn good when in the Philippines heat. Nose is a bit like straw and a little sour, taste is pretty clean albeit a little grainy and the hops are nowhere to be found. Finish is clean and refreshing, thats about all there is to it. Cheers.
Rated based on notes taken 2 Mar 2012 -- Suprisingly I really liked this brew; Even for a Light lager.

Half liter can smuggled back from Dubai by Joe M, thanks for the opportunity! Pale golden color with a smallish quickly dissipating bone white tightly bubbled head. Light bready pilsner malt, faint floral hop, hints of light fruitiness. The taste is big sweet bread with a bit of fruitiness and little to no hop flavor. Middle of the road macro style pilsner/lager.

Jaune pâle et très limpide, des bulles énervées forment un collet tout d’abord épais mais qui part rapidement. Des céréales surtout sucrées, comprenant fort probablement du maïs, dominent le bouquet de cette bière. Une pointe étrangement fumée perce également. En bouche, c’est beaucoup trop sucré pour le style, ce qui crée un goût assez désagréable en général. Elle est quand même meilleure que la "IPA" de l’Alchiermou.
From can at the Hong Kong airport. Straw yellow with a thin white head that dissipates quickly. No lacing. Aroma of corn and cereal. Taste is sweet with just a hint of hops. Active carbonation.

Bottle from eDrinks in Tallinn (€ 0,78). BB 04-2015. Clear golden colour, head was big initially but dropped fast and left some lacing. Nose as expected - sweet, malty, grainy, corny. Taste similar, semisweet with nearly non-existent bitterness. Crisp carbonation, body not exactly light, but nearing medium, palate somewhat sticky with dry finish. Faint bitterness in the finish, kind of. 



I don’t know - perhaps I’m in the mood right now for a cheap-ass adjunct lager but I really don’t think this is entirely terrible, in fact, I think I’ve had worse "craft" beers. Deserves a better rating than 4/100.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a yesllow clear colour with white head that diminish fast. Aroma of wheat. Medium bitterness, medium sourness. Boring palate. Watery and plain.

Bottle @ Maksimarket. pours clear golden with minimum white head. Aroma of malts,light smoke.Taste is malty, very light bitterness. Nothing special.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with an off white head. Aroma of typical rice based lager, a little grainy and sweet malt like but really not much going on. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with moderate to high carbonation.
appearance: golden, sparkling, white; taste: medium bitter; palate: medium body, thin texture, lively carbonation, bitter finish; i like this beer overall for all occasions.

33 cl. bottle. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and a bitter finish.
Bottle from LCBO, Parkway Mall, Scarborough, ON. Pours a clear straw colour with a small white head. Aroma of bread and pilsner yeast. Lively carbonation. Pleasantly bitter finish.

What can I say, its a Pale Ale. It looks like one, it smells like one and it tastes like one. But in a warm Dubai that is OK, and it comes from far away, and it added another country tick, so who cares. (Dubai 201409)
An ordinary pale lager I had when I was in the Phillipines. Easy to drink and suitable for the warm climate.

caramel, hay, cereal, chocolate, coffee, nuts, toast, citrus, grass, spruce, herbs, dough, cheese, banana, clove, slightly vanilla, palely golden, clear, white beautifully foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, lively

Wheaty aroma. Yellow, clear, white head goes fast. Medium bitterness, medium sourness. Boring palate. Watery and plain.
Cheeeeeeerrrrrrssss! Cheeeeeeerrrrrrssss! Cheeeeeeerrrrrrssss! Cheeeeeeerrrrrrssss! Cheeeeeeerrrrrrssss!

The Philippines’ standard lager, with pale yellow blonde colour and frothy head. Grainy, clear corn presence but not the somewhat more refined rice I’m used to from Asian lagers, mild aromatic hops. Thin and bland, but I had worse among similar European brews.

I’m not entirely convinced that this beer isn’t actually a mix of crappy beer, corn syrup and some type of urine, either human or animal. I’m awaiting the lab results.
For some reason I also thought it would be fun to review two "classic" Pilsners back to back, one a true classic (Pilsner Urquell), the other one...this.Then I also thought it would be a good idea to drink the Urquell first. It wasn’t. I should’ve started with this travesty instead. Thank god I have another Urquell in the fridge. To be fair, if the lab results don’t actually contain urine, I may bump my review up to a 2.
Another adjunct lager. Low on flavors and aromas, light bodied and slightly astringent. Some skunk. Nothing noteworthy.

330ml tinnie consumed on a Hong Kong stopover. A below average pale lager with sweet corn malts and a low hop bitterness. Typical mass produced affair.

330 ml bottle. Pale straw gold color. Large foamy white head. Light grainy malt nose redolent of corn. Sweet malt flavor with more corn. Light body and flavor. Just a whisp of dry hops in finish. Not much going on here.

330ml bottle from a supermarket in Tallinn, clear gold colour, medium fizzy mostly lasting white head, fair lacing. Moderately malty aroma of grain, hay and corn, light spicy hops. Taste is initially slightly sweet and not much else, turning into a mildly bitter finish with a slightly alcoholic feel. Light body, dry texture, lively carbonation. A fairly boring and uninteresting below-average lager.
Mercadeo engañoso porque dice pale pilsener y ciertamente es pálida pero no tienen nada de pale
Can. Hazy, golden, frothy, white foam, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.

Bottle from a karaoke bar in Quezon City, Philippines. Color of transparent gold with foamy white head. Aroma of malts and funk. Taste of malts, funk and corn. Probably one of the worst beers I’ve had, but it was semi-cold on a stifling hot July night.

33 cl bottle as "San Miguel Premium Pale Pilsen" from a supermarket in HK, 18.90 HK$, quite expensive, made in New Territories, HK. Yellow color, big bubbly white head. Subtle nose of grains. Aroma: at first was "yuck!", but then mild grains, corn, glucose. After a while a lagery tone wakes up, cornflakes, alcohol already noticeable. Taste is uncertain, flat. Quite unrefined and average, light bodied, slick feel, carbonated, anonymous finish. Not really worth the price

Aroma is a skunky dry maltiness withight sweetness. Light graininess and partial sulphur notes. Taste is light crystal malt character with slight bland dry malt finish. Appearance is a clear gold with a thin pearl head that retains poorly
Bottle. No label taken. Pours gold with white head. Nose/taste of fruity sweet grain, light corn and malt. Lighter medium body.
Bottle from backlog notes 07. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have grainy malts, corn, skunk, grass, slightly less offensive than some pale lagers.

320ml bottle. PD 25/01/2012 - ED: 25/01/2014 - AEF 11-010  
 The nose is grainy, smooth. The beer starts neutral-grainy, smooth, but dusty-malty. The mainpart is the same, dust, malt, not very fresh. The aftertaste has hints of bitterness, lots of dust. 
 Easy to drink, not very fresh beer.
Bottle. Clear pale gold with a big white rocky head. Aroma is straight skunk. Taste imparts a little fruity sweetness. Surprisingly slick mouthfeel. Not much carb. Not good.

Cervesa suau i refrescant, el que s’espera d’una industrial.
Cerveza suave y refrescante, lo que se espera de una industrial.

Clear light golden with bubbly white head. Pear, peach, light sweet dough, some grass and herbs. Quite fresh light fruity sweetness with slight dry finish. Light bodied. Nice pils. Another bottle in 2015 (why?). Quite skunky and some cardboard, unbalanced and too sweet. Not very good.
Tap at hook, tampere. Golden coloe, white head. Aroma is malts and metal. Taste is basic finnish lager, metallic and malty.

11.2oz bottle, from Jungle Jim’s in Fairfield. Cool stubby custom-molded bottle. Clear golden color. Good thin kind of bubbly white head. Leaves good thicker lace, pretty impressive appearance for a pale lager, really. Medium body. Smooth, lightly soft, kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. Good, smooth, easy-drinking texture. Pretty impressive, love dat texture, despite the taste... Flavor comprises of some metallic macro twang, you know that disctinctive flavor. How to describe it? It’s got some good mildly peppery pilsner hops / malts, that’s nice, but then some odd metallic mustiness. Nice moderate sweet taste, light bitterness. Nice distinct perfect islander lager twang to it. Pretty damn solid pils. What’s happening here? Just had the dunkel earlier tonight with my dinner, I was impressed with that, too. This is a macro in the Philippines??? Who is the world power again? WTF AB-InBev??? Why can’t you do it like this? Shit. Makes me frustrated that the national lager of the philipines is this and we here in the US are stuck with Bud. We’re a country of profit margins, obviously, when what many of us consider to be a 3rd world country can make a lager this good in such mass quantities. It’s probably even better over there in the domestic. These guys are living the life. Good pils.

Bottle. Crystal clear and very pale yellow, with a white quickly diminishing head. Corn and grain are the big flavours here. Hints of hops, very light and a little skunky. May have been an old bottle, but still. Could be worse, but there's really nothing to love here.
Can. Golden pale color with almos no head. Almost no aroma, light malty maybe. In aftertaste light hops. Nothing interesting.

Bottle from local Yamaya store. Sweetish malt nose, light Saaz-y hop, and just a touch of sewerish stuff. Medium straw color. Mild sweet malt initial with some amount of cardboard / rough it of hops in mid / finish has a more or less bitter edge. Thin-medium body, a bit too spritzy. Light. Not badly made.

HK version, bottle from my student. fruity citrus, grass, corn, candy nose. Clear, deep gold, nice fine head. Bready, corny, ok hops, some citrus, almost no bitterness. Oh, no, there is some, all right, actually. Crisp body. Not terrible by any means, just lacking distinction. All right for an industrial lager.

This beer is nothing special just a basic beer.I am filling in space now.......................

Backlog. Tried it bottled. Just your standard mass-produced lager. Nothing to get excited about.
0.33l bottle. Pours light golden whit medium white-off head. Taste is rather artificial... grain, grassy hops, Aroma is same.. Carbonation is medium. Very bad beer, I don’t like it at all..
Clear golden pale lager, small head, nice aromas hops and malt notes, clear taste a little watery hops flavor quite right for a Pilsen. Enjoyable after all.
Rather boring bottle. Tastes differently than the Spanish San Miguel. I quite liked it and could have a few of these.

OLD NOTES SEP 21, 2004
Reasonably strong aroma of light malt and hops. Pours golden body with bubbly white head. Odd flavour to be honest. Light malt body with a metallic bitterness and fruit flavours, possibly apple. Nothing outstanding, and definately not worthy of the title ’pilsener’.

Old note from 2008, gift or bought? Clear pale golden color, moderate white head, disappears quickly; sweet nose, grain, grassy hops; light sweetness and bitterness; light body, watery to oily texture, average carbonation is soft; sweetbitter finish

Poured from a bottle into a glass while in Thailand.
Aroma has a medium light graininess. Medium light hop character that is slightly woody as well as floral and grassy. 
Pours a clear, pale golden yellow with a moderately thick white head that shows average retention. Light lacing and no legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness, but finishes crisp and dry. Light malt flavor with light hop notes. Light bitterness. Hops are woody with some floral and grassy notes. Flavor has a surprisingly strong water character to it. No sulfur or diacetyl. 
Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a surprisingly weak alternative to Thai beers, this is very clean but is less flavorful than the Thai lagers. Also, there is something in this beer that is causing me to have an allergic reaction, I believe it is a type of hops but I am not sure which type.

Rating #948 - February 3, 2014 - Beer 1 of 8 in @coopwinespirits February Discovery Beer Bag - My first beer from the Phillipines? - Clear golden pour. Bubbly white head. Smells like grassy, grainy euro lager. Taste is up to that par, light grassiness, very light maltiness. Light bodied, barely there alcohol, medium-heavy carbonation. A rip roaring Meh! for me.

0,33L can. Pours and smells like typical macro pale lager. Taste is rather sweet, but somewhat artificial. It is over carbonated. Overall: rather disgusting beer. This one is rather bad even by macro lager standards.

Had a few of these beers while in the Philippines. The beer had an average-dark gold color with a smaller foamy white head with modest retention, lacing, and cling. Its aroma was not distinctive, with lighter notes of barley, grain, and perhaps corn. It was a mostly and lightly bitter grainy beer with some light malt and barley characters. A thinner, average-wetness beer with a light mouthfeel and lower carbonation.
Can, from the can. Aromas of grain, bread, and a metallic note. Easy drinking here and pretty plain. Grain, bread, and a sweet finish. Just decent

Goldgelbe Farbe, wenig Schaum. Geruch leicht malzig, muffig.

Sampled alongside several of the other varieties. This one is very similar to the mig light, but pours a dark piss yellow and the lacing isn’t as sticky. A little more buttery as well. I will say, that off all the brews they make, this is in the top quartile. But that still isn’t saying all that much.

320ml bottle. Light golden with almost no head. 
NOSE : biscuit, bread with butter, some delicate citrus notes. 
SIP : the beer is well carbonated and has a water like texture. It’s sweet and stays like that till the end. It has a very delicate bitterness. 
OVERALL : the beer is cloying sweet. Good thing about it it has a good carbonation.

(Bottle) Pours in clear pale body with almost no head, only a white ring. Aroma has mostly malt notes, with some fruitiness, hints of wet straw. Taste is malt sweet with notes of cooked corn, medium bitterness, short lasting. Body is medium with oily and dry texture, carbonation is medium.
Pour from can, this beer is light gold in color. Adequate head but flattens fast. Smell a little bit citrus and taste a bit corn and bitter. Overall, drinkable and better than I expected.

Appearance: Clear golden color with a fine white head that ends up in a white laver, and leaves some lacing.
Aroma: Mild hoppy and mild malty.
Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a mild bitterness. Average carbonation.
Taste: Fresh malty and light hoppy.
Overall impression: Plain decent lager. Quite fresh actually.

Really like this kind of stubby bottle. Its perfect island beer. Not bad but not particularly special. A mild malt taste with some carbonation and not much bitterness. Its kind of thin refreshing beer you would have in summer time. Its pretty smooth, and doesnt have over whelmping or skanky after taste.

smells like a sweet Pilsner, tastes like one too...sweetness lasts on the palette for a while, light and refreshing besides that...maltier than other pilsners...smooth and good..gets a bit worse with warmth
Blonde claire, effervescence moyenne, col blanc moyen. Au niveau des arômes et du goût: une pils vraiment pas top...

330ml bottle. Clear golden body, small white head with average retention for a lager. Aroma sweet malt, corn, herbs, metallic notes, a little skunky. Taste of sour-sweet mash, herbs, strongly metallic and mineral. Nasty!

Very happy when I saw this one in a shop, but was slightly disapointed.

The taste is nothing special - not bitter nor sweet, quite hoppy and almost too grainy. Also lacks a bit of bubbles to make it more refreshing. All in all, not very pleasant.
Pours a clear golden with a big white head. Aroma of... what aroma? There’s a bit of grain and hay, but that’s about it. Very watery.

Bottle. This is a pretty standard pale lager. Not bad but not particularly special. A mild malt taste with some carbonation and not much bitterness.

Somewhat dark-yellow colored beer with a white layer of foam. A somewhat sour aroma, but it tastes a but more like malt. It ends with a very little bitter aftertaste.

ietwat donkergelig pils met een witte kraag. Een ietwat zurig aroma, maar de smaak is iets voller en iets moutiger. Het laat een kleine bittere nasmaak achter.
LCBO. Basic beer, little taste nor mouthfeel. You would think they would use better water.
Bottle in the Philippines. A light lager, a bit of metal in the taste. A nice beer on a sunny day.

Can in Hong Kong. Pale beer, medium head (well, duh). Slightly grainy and malty arome, a little bit of hops. The metallic notes are unfortunately also there. Body is light, carbonation medium. OK.

very clear golden, with bad head retention. aroma is rotten apples and skunk, very unpleasant. aftertaste is super skunky with some very mild hop bitterness. Overall: Hope this was a skunky bottle, because this was really horrible.

Popular in Taiwan. I assume this is the correct place to rate it. Although I drink it in bottles now and again I had it on draught and had to review. It was clean , crisp, light and very refreshing. Basically what you want in a pilsner. Very enjoyable on a hot day.
Poured clear golden with a small, disappearing head. Aroma of sweet grainy malt. Medium to light body, flavour as the aroma, sickly sweet with dry finish.
From notes: Poured clear golden-amber with a 2-finger white head. Aroma is light, with notes of lemon and corn. Body is light and somewhat watery. Flavor of lemon with some corn in the finish.

Can, at the Cathay lounge in HK. Totally forgettable. I had San Miguel for years while I served the Philippines in a different life, and under a different point of view, as far as beer was concerned. Bottle given to me following a friends visit to a Philippine festival in London. Clear light gold colour with an average size white head. Aroma of malts, hops and corn. Fairly thin texture, average carbonation. Had worse.
Beer of choice during my visit to the Philippines. Solid lightly bodied beer with crisp clean taste. Little bit of hops flavor.
An average beer with its typical characters of blond beer. Good for calm thrist. Does not say too much
330 ml bottle. Pours golden, not very pale. Medium head but no lacing. Smooth but lacks bitternes and is too watery.

(Can, 0.3 l - the Hong Kong version, courtesy of rosenbergh, 20130724) The beer poured pale golden and clear. Its head was small, white and it disappeared quickly. Aroma had starch and sweetness. Palate was light bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, starch and hint of bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet. Tastes like a soda with hint of bitterness. I’m unable to like this.

Bottle from the beer store. Pale yellow, fizzy white head. Aroma of dry grass and urine. I’m gonna give it this - it does taste like the remnants of a pilsner, not just a crappy lager. Not sure how they accomplish this. It’s still not good. Drink it very cold and smile for your filipino friends.
I expected nothing and got nothing. It’s just an average faceless lager. Better than water though.
Bottle. Clear light copper color with a minimal head. Aroma of grain and hay. Mild malty taste. Watery texture, medium carbonation.

Aroma of straw and grain. Pours a clear yellow with no head or lacing. The taste is less than rewarding. Corn, with a light bitter finish. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Sadly, not much going on here.

Bottle. Pours golden yellow with a small white head. Aromas of malt, hay and corn. Light on flavor and hops. Medium carbonation.

330ml bottle from the LCBO. pours clear yellow with a small, quick, white head. soft aroma of light pale malt, powdered sugar, floral hops. the flavour starts sweet with light maltiness and some sugar. the finish is just and the sweet side of balanced. no over carbonated. decent.
On the expensive side for the taste, metallic aftertaste, clean, fairly simple pilsner.

330 ml can. Brewed in Hong Kong. P081112. BB 08/11/13. From Estonia. Thanks Tom!

Pale golden colour with a tiny white head.
The aroma is farmyard, some sweetness and malt. The flavour is sweetness, malt and mild bitterness. Quite useless pale lager.

320 ml bottle. Nürnberg, Germany.
Clear golden colour with small white head.
Malty aroma with hints of apple. Sweet malty flavour with apple. Quite boring.
From a bottle. Pours clear gold with a thin foamy head. Smells sweet and dry, like cider. Dry feel with hints of malt and sweetness. Light body and medium carbonation.
Bottle. Pours clear gold with creamy, white head. Aroma is corn, straw, rice, and light funk. Flavor is heavy corn and dry malts with some grassy notes; dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Bottle @ home. Pours clear pale gold with a medium, fizzy white head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is meal and cereal malt. Flavor is malt dominant with faint hops and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
A pretty mediocre-- but not terrible-- lager import.  It’s about what you would expect: bland but maybe thirst-quenching.

The appearance combines a clear golden color with a large white head, and the subtle aroma combines hints of sour dough yeast and sweet bread malts. The taste is quite sour, and the palate combines an abrupt finish, a thin yet (weirdly) creamy texture, soft carbonation, and a medium body.

Ciekawa pekata butelka i lakierowana. Zolty kolor jak pils klasyczny wyglad, babelki itp. Piana slaba i znika w mgnieniu. A smak niestety bez tresci i wyrazu. Nawet slabo orzezwia to piwo. Metaliczny i ryzowo-kukurydziany posmak.
Can, 5%. Weak grainy aroma, not unpleasant. Clear yellow colour. Small white head. The flavour is slightly grainy with a low to medium bitterness. Not so flavourful, but quite clean.

Bottle. Pours clear pale golden with quickly vanishing white head. Clear aroma of hops and yeast with a flowery note. Bitter, hoppy and grassy flavour, ending on an acetic note. Perhaps really good on the beach in the summer, otherwise just drinkable.

No real colour, pours to a white head that falls off to nothing in a second flat.  No lacing.  Low malt notes if any.  Bitter but not from hops almost artificial flavour.  This beer is bloating and needs to be chilled to near zero  to reduce to high carbonation. I am not sure why this one gets accolades as it is just another pale lager brewed from heavy use of corn sugar or similar adjunct.  .

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beerandbeyond store. Thanks Ariel Straw blond, small white head. Artificial lemon juice, cleaning detergent aroma and slightly bitter tastelessness. Light body, mildly carbonated and short finish.

Synd at RB ikke har et eget kriterium for minner. Husker at vi drakk rikelig av San Miguels filipinske utgave på Filipinene, og at den gjorde det den skulle. Akkurat der og da smakte den fyldig og godt, men det var den gang... Ny rating i Brussel med flaske kjøpt på kinesisk supermarked: På flasken står det faktisk "for domestic sale only"! Bb 07/14. Lys med lite og kort skum. Lite smak og ettersmak fantes ikke.

Bottle. Sweet grainy malt aroma.  Clear gold with a large white head. Sweet grainy malt and a touch of grassy hops. Body on the light side of medium, lively carbonation. I was expecting much worse, and although not great, it’s drinkable.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur dorée pâle et claire. Nez de grains de malt pâle sucrés avec des notes de pain, de maïs sucré, de fruits (pommes) ainsi que quelques traces de houblon floral. Plutôt mince en bouche avec un pétillement plutôt bas et une texture légèrement aqueuse. Goût légèrement croustillant de grains de malt pâle sucrés avec des traces fruitées (jus de pomme) lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi d’un léger goût de maïs sucré avec de très faibles traces de miel puis en finale l’on retrouve une très légère amertume de houblon floral. Post-goût très court, composé de faibles notes herbeuses avec des traces de grains. (2006)

330 ml can, local version available just about everywhere in HK.



Piss-like golden yellow colour; Thin head and white foam which fades in 20 seconds; Minimal lacing and active carbonation; Initially pungent smell of malt, corn and rice which dies down rather quickly; Sweet taste of light malt, rice, light wet cardboard, citrus, grass, rubber, and rubbing alcohol; Watery body and palate, with rubbery and bad booze taste becomes increasingly nasty with further sips. Yuck! Hoppiness is considerably stronger than most macros, with bitterness comes out mid way for a mild and lasting finish. Quite dry after taste, very easy to mouth.



Comments: My first ever taste of beer was the local San Mig as a child. I had vague memory for that, but my friends and elders who had this keep telling me it was a rich and strong brew back then, not the watery swill it is today. Fast forward to now: the most popular brew in HK now comes with rubbing alcohol and rubbery taste to complement its already lowly image as fast selling beer water. Totally unbalanced, and the rubbery bad booze bonus is the last straw. I can only stand half a glass and the rest is drain pours. “The beer for Hong Kong people”? My answer is a resounding “No”.
Pours pale golden with a continental head, aroma is faint malts grain, taste is similer small grainy and floral hop profile, classic Spanish lager really
Bottle->mini lager.  Pale yellow with frothy white head.  Aroma: bread and malt.  Taste: sweethrass with metallic notes.  Not good.
12oz bottle. Pours a clear straw color with a large foamy head. Aroma is neutral except for some light grass notes. Not much taste. Some grassy notes and a little malt.

2 finger head that leavs fast. Some carbination. Pale golden. Can smell it from a distance,kinda hard to explaine something with warmth like spice or mabye some kinda skunk I don’t know. The beer in glass smells like that with some apple juice smell in the back lightly. Taste I’d say it’s like trying to be a lemon beer or something without that. Grassy,hoppy a bit,I can’t fully explaine this one fully well,but it’s allright for a try. Cheer’s.

Bottle. Clear sunshine yellow. White head. No aroma sticks out. Just some mild basement aroma. Medium body. Nothing lingers. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled 330ml ; Devon ; UK ; Malty,cereal and grassy aroma ; Yellow to golden color with proper head ; Medium sweet and medium bitter taste ; Watery ; Not bad.

Pours pale golden; forthy two-finger head that fades off to a thin cover of bubbles pretty quickly.
Smells like beer with a complement of sour corn mash.
Malty sweetness in the flavor profile, but there’s a good bit of sourness there, too. A hint of hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste.
Thin, watery mouthfeel, but decent carbonation.
Wouldn’t be bad on a sweltering day. Definitely better than Bud.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear golden coloured with slightly malty taste, an overall well balanced macro lager. But this beer work very well in the Philippines and rest of east and South-East Asia.

Medium white head. Clear yellow body with carbonation. Light strawy toffee aroma, very weak. Dryish papery fruity taste with strawy notes. Light body. Fizzy mouthfeel. Dry dusty papery aftertaste with strawy earthy notes. It’s not bad, but low on flavour. (0.33l bottle from some supermarket in Hong Kong.)

330ml can, brewed by San Miguel Hong Kong. Pours pale golden with a rough white head. Somewhat sweetish aroma with grain and hint of metal. Flavour is sweetish cereal, mainly maize or rice, and hint of metal as well. The finish has a weak note of hops. Not the worst beer China has to offer.

Mittelpilsige Farbe und sehr wenig Schaum. Maisartiges Popcornaroma. Dünner Antrunk. Getreidige Noten im Geschmack, dazu eine geradezu mehlige Hopfenherbe im Abgang; vielleicht kommt das vom Reis im Sud. Nicht wirklich gelungen.

A thin head on a clear, bright golden colored body.
The aroma is non-existent; the mildest grain.
The taste is mildly bitter and then watery middle to end. 
A crisp texture, high carbonation and light body.
A lot going against this beer: smell, no taste and high carbonation coming up at the top of the list.
Bottle. Pours a light yellow gold with white head. Aroma is weak hops. Tree taste is carbonated and of white bread. Quite sweet but refreshing.
Bottle shared with McTapps. A nice surprise due to the quaffy drinkability and the medium carbo in. Aroma of malt  and bit sweetish make that beer an easy to go one.

Aromas of floral noble hops and some hay.  Very pale gold with white head foam, light retention.  Taste is dry, with light caramel, and spicy floral hop bitterness.  Palate is light bodied, with mild carbonation, and has a light, short, spicy finish.

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch (opened it for a little celebration in the late afternoon after our daughter made her first five steps alone *so proud*). Clear golden colour with low head. Finely carbonated, medium boody. Nose of low malt. Taste of medium malt, mild hops, grass, hay and sour apples. Good and solid PL.

pours apple juice yellow, almost all no head, and slow streams. A pretty muted nose. Drinks with a lot of fizziness, very rough mouth feel, bready, finishing jagged and dry. Low complexity, low depth, no good carry, and no good depth. Not recommended at all, perhaps as a meal beer but barely at that.
Available at various places in Hong Kong. Appearance and taste have nothing special to offer, but quite OK for a hot climate lager. Recommended with spicy foods.

Bottle. Pours pale golden yellow with a medium fizzy white head that dissipates quickly with little lacing. Aroma is corny and grassy. Flavor is about the same, light plus sweetness, definite corn syrup notes. Light grassy bitter finish. Light bodied. Typical.

Not the same as I enjoyed in the PI, but damn close. Normally find the larger, this is the proper Pale Pilsen! Rare to find, this has a bit of an aftertaste not familiar with the non-imported version, but after a second sip, that aftertaste is quickly unnoticed. Good smooth, light.

Bottle from Haus der 131 Biere, Hamburg. Clear yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, light malty and grainy. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. Watery. 221212
Clear yellow, white head.  Soft malt on nose.  Sweet.  bready, but a  bit thinin the middle.  Lightly bitter hop finish.  Better than some, not great.
(Can) Clear yellow amber with bug white head. Grassy tangy refreshing aroma light bodied and fizzy. Flavour is rather sharp with a none too pleasant metallic bitterness in finish. Overall it is ok.

From bottle to glass.  Hay, corn aroma with some yeasty coconut aroma.  Slight sweet taste and mild bitterness in the end.  Kind of a foul meat aftertaste though.  Overall not bad, but not really all that good.  It’s also quite overpriced.
Can. Big white foam, golden colour. Strong carbonized. Malt and matal flavor. Roast barley malt taste. Dry taste.
Pale amber color; Light to medium body; Aroma of malt, & subtle fruit; Flavor of slight sweet malt, light hops, and some caramel; Finish is slightly sour/acidic; Overall, a bit bland - but decent.
Golden color with white head, malt aroma. Medium bodied and drinkable with a little sweetness.

Bottled. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of brewing cereal, malt, and metal. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, grain, metal, and brewing cereal, leading to a dry finish. The body is light.
Not bad tasting, just not enough there to enjoy. Taste and aroma are on the weak side, and mouthfeel is watery. A little extra effort could make this a decent lager.

Ah, the pale pilsen! I’ve had literally hundreds of these during my trips to the Philippines. It’s actually quite decent. Aroma is sweetish with almost a hint of caramel malt, taste is similarly towards the sweet side but with just a hint of bitterness to balance it. Body is light but carbonation is kept in check with helps the overall impression.

Pours a clear golden color with abillowing head that fades to bits of lacing. Aroma of malt sweetness, bit of citrus with some grain. Taste has a bit of a hops nip with amild malt sweetness and grain. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, crisp smooth and refrshing. Perfect beer for the hot humid weather in Manila.

12oz bottle from The Foodery, Center City, Philadelphia. Pale straw with a billowing, creamy looking, white head; sweet, grainy aroma; surprisingly full in the mouth with a substantial grainy body, and some gentle, floral, hops. Much better than I expected - I bought it to get the country tick - but ending up quite enjoying it.
light body, thin feel, fizzy, nice gift from the canary islands, but only for hot hot summer drinking

It pours a very thin extremely transparent gold with a white head that quickly fades and leaves a bit of lacing.  The aroma can only be described as a little skunky and slightly funky.  The taste is pretty bland other than a strange undetectable flavor at the finish.  It’s very light but rather crisp and somewhat refreshing.  Blah.
The head is medium, the body intensive yellow. It smells CO² a bit citrus, malty. The taste is malty, citrus, refreshing, a bit hoppy, and a bit mild. Overall medium. 10/9/8/8/11/9
Boring pale lager. You know what to expect. Straw yellow pour, soapy white head. Faint smells of malt on the nose. Weak and watery.

33cl bottle.
Thin white head.  Clear golden pour.  An ok pilsner.  Thirst quenching but that’s all.
Beer-marathon, Sdr. Borup / Randers the 2012th Light yellow beer with a white head. Aroma of malt and light hops. The flavor follows the nose

5% Clear very light Gold. Thin layer of head

Slight fruit in the nose,pineapple,distinct  light sweet grain.

Taste is a mellow sweet grain, with light fruit pineapple, slightly tart appley, with a kind of peppery,slightly grassy finish. Smooth crisp,soft wet,slightly dry some skunky /vomit bile harshness in the finish. Finish seems to progressivly become harsher and more vile with slight warming. Drink this cold and fast.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Total Wine Sterling.  It’s a fizzy yellow beer with a large and sticky head of white foam.  The nose smells like a touch of grain and skunky noble hops with a touch of metal.  The flavor is a mix of alcohol, slight florals, tin, and dirt.  Light on the tongue with a nasty aftertaste.  I would  certainly say there some adjuncts in this.  God knows what the put in this crap.
cereal, pale, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, flat, light dry finish.

Pours pale yellow and absolutely crystal clear. Head is minimal. Nose is mild sweet malts, mild fruity and floral hops but hard to get much aroma at all after drinking a Noble Pils. Flavor is sweet malts, mild flowery hop flavor. Bitter and moderate carbonation keep it crisp. Not a bad beer but really lacking hop flavor and aroma.
Bottle pour into shaker.  Sudsy head, pale gold.  A bit of sweet maltiness, but otherwise not much to taste.

I really expected this to be a cheap trash beer only known for its low cost buzz by former military members stationed in the PI and tourists but...    I really liked it even though I’m in the minority!  Smooth and easy to drink on a hot day.  Definately will try this one again!

Bottle, bought @ LIVA, Kolding.

Pours pale clear golen with a fine, staying, frothy, white head. ARoma has maize, light sugar, soft citrus. Medium carbonation, a bit thin mouthfeel. Flavour is mild, sweetish, maize, very soft brewing cereal, subdued citrus bitter. For the style, this is quite drinkable.
Bottle.  Pours a pale gold with a small white head.  Aroma of grain and malt.  Taste is similar with just a bit of hops.  Not much going on with this beer.
Bottle.Clear golden colour with large white head.Aroma is fresh malty with hint of cake and hops,good crispy taste and munch better then the one made in Spain.

Bottle from Murat Food Centre, Gedling Street, Nottingham.  No relation to the common-all-garden Spanish giant; rare to see this Filipino beer in the UK.  Pours amber, no head, high carbonation.  Aroma is quite pleasant for a pale lager - less skunkiness and more bitter hoppiness.  The taste is a surprise, too: initially strongly bitter and dry with citrus, orange, a hint of banana, ginger nut biscuits and pineapple.  Bittersweet finish which is a lot longer than many a pale lager, with a likeable fizz at the end.  Overall, I’m impressed - despite the bland appearance - and this is my new favourite pale lager, which is a bit like having a favourite tropical disease.
Yeah pretty much just a run-of-the-mill pale lager. Not really any flavor or aroma, just inoffensive and light. Completely forgettable.

Clear golden straw with a light head covering and a thin layer of lace.  Taste is another "industrial" beer: adjunct (corn?/rice?) provides an off- flavor that doesn’t invite a second bottle.  There is only light bittering from the carbonation, nothing else.  Quite weak.
golden with small head. this is your basic mediocre lager. actually, mediocre may be overdoing it. watery with very slight unpleasant aftertaste.
320ml bottle. Clear golden colour with small to average frothy white head. Bitter hop aroma, a strawy note. Monotonous strawy taste, light body, if able denoting, then soapy "finish".

Lived on this beer for three years. So glad to be back in North America. SMB is the staple beer of the Philippines. It’s a full tasting beer with an unregulated alcohol content, in Philippines at least. Avoid it if you can.
This one isn’t very good, but it’s very lager-y. It’s on the level of "I don’t want to drink this again" and isn’t something I’d recommend.

33cl bottle in Siem Reap. Clear pale golden with a small white head. Light malty aroma with a hint of caramel and a faint hint of hops. Sweet with very little bitterness. Far from what we know as pils, but no unpleasant aromas or flavours. Easy to drink and quite nice in the heat. (2012-05-03)

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear pale gold with minimal head. Aroma of light hops and a little sour apple. Taste is very lightly bitter and very lightly sweet. Light bodied with a thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, I’ve had worse. But another country gets checked off the list.
Pours a light golden color. Smell is malts, slightly sweet. Taste is crisp, mild, some malts and grains. Overall an easy drinking warm weather beer.

This beer certainly has a monopoly over the Philippines beer world. Not bad not bad, just another SEA macrobrew, the rice is definitely there but I never had a bad one. Made my trip that much more enjoyable.

Bottle from Total Wine in Sacramento, CA. Pours light gold with a foamy/creamy white head. Aroma is bready with some grassy/herby hop. Med minus body. Flavor is lightly bready with some very mild hop. Doesn’t really come together for me. 
Earlier Rating: 2/25/2007 Total Score: 2.1
Somewhat grassy, corny aroma. Thinh golden color with a white head that laces a bit. Decent mouthfeel. Taste is clean, but virtually non-existant. There is a very light sweetness, and there is offsetting hop in the finish. Just not much of anything though.
330ml bottle, brewed in Hong Kong. Dark yellow, orange color. Very thin head, almost flat. Watery metallic aroma, faint hops. Light bitter hops, but mainly watery body.
Quiet refreshing and ok pilsener. Nice carbonation, not too watery, not too sweet.
Aroma of fritos ick...pours pale yellow...taste is eww..skunky flat piss...never again
Aroma has some cereal and corn notes. Totally watery taste. Only some mild maltiness is detectable and a slightly bitter aftertaste.
Bottle - small foamy head, pale straw color, weird bad malt aroma and flavor - not good at all
Peu de difference avec la San Miguel de base. Peu être un peu plus de houblon et d’amertume

330 ml can, in Bali, brewed under licence by PT Delta, Indonesia. ABV is 4.9%. Pale golden colour, low white head. Weak aroma, some "dusty" malts.  Fizzy mouthfeel. Bland pale lager flavour, at least it is not too sweet. Boring.

33 cl bottle. Rated on 30.03.2010

Pale and bright. Stale aroma with some grainy malt. Flavour is rather light with some bitterness, grainy malt and hints of sourness. Reminds me a bit of Finnish bulk lagers – very easy to drink and even more easy to forget.

Pours a clear pale gold with a 3 finger, frothy white head. Aroma of sweet cereal, corn, grassy and planty hops and a light tree fruit note. Flavor is cereal, light sweet malt, toast, grassy hops, toffee, apple skin and finishes a bit too sweet with an off lightly metallic note. Palate is light bodied, with a dry, though slightly slick feel throughout and a fairly strong, but not too sharp carbonation. Pretty good for the style.

Pours clear golden like a pils should. Froth white head.  Aroma is sligtly fruity, cereal and i think hallertauer hops. Taste is clean up front  very light fruity flavor   good carbonation, some cereal malt taste. Overall i was expecting way worse  this isnt that bad.....i thought this was an ok pilsner lager

330ml bottle pours a pale straw color with a finger of white head that settled down to leave no lacing.  Aroma is cereal grains and faint hops.  Taste is light malty sweetness with a mild hoppy bitterness.  Standard macro lager.
