330ml bottle pours a pale straw color with a small white head and no lacing.  Aroma is mild cereal grains and faint hops.  Taste is light malty sweetness and a mild hoppy bitter finish.  Light bodied and lively carbonation.  Just another average pale lager.
Yellow color with a white head. The aroma is corn and grain like. A little sweet malt up front and some hops in the middle.

A sour grain almost medicine like aroma. Pale yellow with a subtle hint of gold. Sweet corn with a touch sourness in the finish. Not a terrible tasting beer but neither is it that good. It’s drinkable but just barely.
clear piss yellow colour, lots of bubbles but little head. smells like piss in a can. Tastes like nothing and finishes like cold urine.
Clear golden/yellow pour thin white head .... aroma is grainy and of sweet malts ..... not much else the taste is the same sweet malty and grainy .... miggy

Drank this guy from the bottle. Bleh. Just finished a Belgian, and this was not a good follow up. Very clear, decent head. Aroma is typical of a larger. Flavor is plain, and of rice and maybe corn... Palate is fizzy, so thisi is a fizzy yellow beer. Bleh.

330ml can in Hong Kong. Boring yellow and little head; what is there is that thin stuff that isn’t even appetimizing. Soft aroma of the cardboard from the bottom of a cheap chocolate box. Flavour is a watery mess of grain and alcohol; weak palate. This brew has succeeded at the impossible - making something even worse than the original San Miguel!
Earlier Rating: 1/1/2010 Total Score: 2
Aroma is a stench of cardboard and alcohol, appearance is a boring bright yellow with little head and no lacing. Tastes of bread with a dry finish, okay palate. It would be good on a hot day, but there is little that’s interesting about this one.
Bread in aroma and flavor.  A very familiar pale lager, not bad just been there had this.

0.33l bottle @ Seoul Airport. Pours a clear golden body with a nice big-bubbly white lager head. Smells like a pale ale alright. Some grainy tones, thin malty and perhaps even a little bit of citrus? Watery texture and it’s average carbonated. Some almost burned rubber hints in the otherwise standard pale lager flavors. A little bitterness also in the aftertaste. Easy to drink despite the rubbery undertones. Not horrible at all, but perhaps a bit boring I guess?

Bottle pours a clear gold with a thick white head. Scent is grain. Taste is lightly sweet and grainy.

Bottle pours a clear gold brew with a frothy thick white head. Scent is musty cereal grain. Taste is bran cereal and metal.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours clear golden with small white head that disspates quickly.  Very little lacing, medium/light body, medium/light carbonation, and skunky aroma that seemed to wear off.  Taste is light malt, some breadiness, and a hint of skunk.

Light golden color, white foamy head.  Very light yeasty aroma, maybe a bit of citrus.  A light flavor of hops and some yeast/citrus.  Very crisp and fizzy palate.  Not bad for an Asian lager, but not outstanding.
Standard swill appearance.  Smells of hay or barley?  Tastes of some malt.. thin.   Not great, but not horrible either.
Bottle at Singapore airport. Not very tasty. Aroma of wet leaves, with a hint of citrus. Taste is sweet, and short-lived. Palate is oily, with a medium body. Yellow, with a frothy head.

330ml can (Stockmann, Tallinn)

3 corny when poured with a big head. As that settles, the carbonation is acrid in the glass. Once that’s disbursed, it’s almost nothing. A bit sweet, corny, and vegetal.

2- pretty pale, brief head.

3+ quite bland, a bit corny, and some actual sugar. However, there are some ester when it warms, and even a hint of hops. But it’s not very nice in any of those aspects.

2- Water and fizzy. Finish is dry, with papery hops, and even some metallic aspects on the teeth.

6 Very much not a good lager, but just keeps itself shy of nastyville. Blandness is a bonus for some of the components.

Bottle: Had this one years ago:
Small white head on top of a light yellow beer.
Hops and malts in the aroma, even a hint of something honey.
Also hops and malts in the taste, with a hint of herbs.
Not bad, but absolutely not the best Pilsener.
It’s beer.  Passable on draft.  Nothing offensive about it.  A bit sweet, fine hot weather lager.
Date: September 24, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Minneapolis Beer Fest.  Full description not available as I sampled way too many beers in 4.5 hours!
bottle.  Pours a clear, pale golden with a big white head.  Nose is of grain.  taste is of grain, but at least is a little sweet.  Mouthfeel is medium-thin and watery with good carbonation.
Bottle at Minneapolis Beer Fest. There really is no shortage of crappy pale lagers, is there? They just keep coming and coming. Oh well, one less that I have to try going forward.

Another good go-to of mine in the adjunct (mass produced) beers! A twist of lemon or lime and let’s fire up the grill or fryer! This brew poured up clear golden-colored body sporting a very bubbly head that quickly dissipated down to a thin sheen that left marginal lacing effects on the glass.  Strong aromas of warm bread, fruits, and something akin to honeysuckles. Very light bodied and well-carbonated.  Sweet malty flavors with an exceedingly refreshing finish with no harsh aftertastes.
Bottle 32cl. A clear yellow color with an average white head. An aroma of malt. The taste is medium sweet. A light body, watery texture, soft carbonation and a abrupt finish.

My cousin brought this back for me from the source. Smells of...umm...not much. Color is a clear yellow with a very thin white head. Thin mouthfeel and doesn’t taste like much. Basically what you’d expect for a cheap beer. If you’re on this site, you know not to order this.
Pours a light golden clear color.  Aroma is of dusty malts, orange peels, and hopls.  Flavor is of malts, hops, raisin, and some dryness.  Leaves a dry malt finish.  I’m actuallly impressed.

Eine merkwürdige Aufmachung hat diese Flasche. Wirkt sehr antiquiert. 
Die Farbe erinnert mich an gedroschenes Stroh. Der Geruch kommt hopfig rüber. 
Das San Miguel wirkt anfangs recht perlig, driftet dann aber massiv in malzige Bereiche ab. Sehr monoton das Ganze .Test vom 21.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Little glass bottle. Beer produced in HongKong. Bought it only for exotic label. Pale yellow color. Aroma is home made wine-like (maybe home made jam also). taste is technical, uninteresting.
Bought a bunch of six packs for a party this summer.  Nothing too bad or good about this beer.  Just a run of the mill below average macro. I’ll take it over a Blue or Bud but that ain’t sayin much.
Bottle. Clear and crisp. A little skunky. Not a bad pale lager, but nothing special here.
Lager lager lager nothing special, especial not in the category of aroma. Faint taste of citrus, so faint I can’t even tell so I wouldn’t take my word for it.

Drank in Thailand. Among my friends, San Miguel is regarded as nearly equal with Beer Lao-- that is, the best of the worst of Asian beers. Goes down far smoother than Chang, Singha, or even Leo, San Miguel tastes less like chemical and more like watered-down alcohol water.
Straight hot weather lager brew. Pours yellow with a thick white head. Corn and light adjunct aroma. Taste is crisp smooth malt, not offensive. A good thirst quencher, but don’t expect more.

330ml bottle. I found this very similar to Mexican and Spanish beer, maybe a little bit better than Corona or Sol. The bottle I had was a stubby bottle, which is cooler than the tall thin Corona bottles, at least.

I had this in Manila and was annoyed because they have a virtual monopoly there and I could never get much else.  Now in Thailand I appreciate it much more than the local competition.... no bad aftertaste, a bit a weird tang that last a half second but it isn’t necessarily unpleasant.  Smell’s not horrible, promises more than the beer delivers

Bottle (320ml) 

Corn with only hints of grain. It’s pretty light on the nose & quite sweet along with some vegetable adjuncts.


Straw colour with a pinky-sized bubbly, white head with poor retention. Crystal clear.


A clean tasting beer. There is some corn & sweet grain along with a little bread. The finish is bitter-sweet & every so slightly skunky.


Light bodied & quite gassy with a bit of fizz in there too. It has an grain like feel to it & the fizz stays with you a while after the sip.



Not a good beer at all & one that certainly doesn’t justify it’s price. Not one area of the beer that I actually enjoyed.
Shared by emacgee.  stale piss golden with no head.  Smells grainy and skunky.  Tastes watery, sweet, corny, and gross.
Bleh, pours as expected. Pale straw yellow with one finger of white head. Skunky with lots of wet hay and bread.
Bottle from oriental food shop. Yellow color with small white head. Aroma of malt and grain. Taste, fruity, some sweet malt, grain. Bittersweet finish. bad.
Nice carbonation, metallic scent, uninteresting flavour. Not entirely horrible.
Can from Thai supermarket. Pours the typical lager looks. Smell and taste is fairly decent; some dusty hops in the finish but otherwise low on characteristics. Not bad, just boring.
Pales when compared to a dunkel or doppelbock. Piss-colored beers just aren’t my thing, anymore. Nothing special here.

Land #66 
Herber, etwas muffiger Antrunk. Untertönig ist das Bier zumindest im Antrunk noch würzig und etwas hopfig, durch eine aufkommende Verwässerung fällt dies weg. Daher wird das Bier zunehmend langweiliger, bleibt aber immerhin spritzig. Wässrig-herber Abgang. 	 
Test vom 13.12.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 8,8,8,8,8,8 - 8,00
Hong Kong version, sold in Estonia. Comes in a strange old-style can. Pale golden, scummy head. Grainy aroma. Light and dry. Some grain sourness in the aftertaste. Nothing special.
Poured into a lager glass from the bottle. Light yellow with dissipating head. Tastes of corn and cereals, like a typical cheap beer. I don’t think this is really a pilsner

Wow. I was very pleasantly surprised by this. A light light flavor, but a good crispness. Tasty.
Earlier Rating: 11/25/2005 Total Score: 2.7
Actually tastes a lttle bit better than I thought. Still isn’t worth getting if a mecrobrew is available, but drinkable if the occasion requires.
bottle, neutrally aroma, pure yellow clear with whit white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, good for hot summer, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, flat, nothing special

Hazy yellow with a massive head that fizzled out.  Arome of corn, barley, slight bit of hoppiness.  Tastes far better than it smells/looks, but still nothing to write home about.  Bit of green apple, wheat and hops in the taste, but to be fair I was expecting far worse based on the smell.  Goes down like water and probably has the same appeal to craft beer drinkers as water does.  The Philippines:  Great food, friendly people, lousy beer.  

*EDIT*  Less corn in the aroma and taste - actually pretty manageable if you drink it cold enough.  Begrudgingly ticked upward.

Can at 5% brought back from the Philippines by a coworker for me to try.  Pours a golden transparent body with a white head, no lacing and poor retention.  Aromatically pear juice, light apple skins, grains, cereal, and some earth notes. Soft pear body, light grass tones, soft and clean nice hop character, a bit rice like and some light apple tones.  Actually i think this is fantastic for a pale lager.  I’m digging it!

San Miguel has a very thick, frothy, white head and a clear, yellow appearance, with a good amount of sticky lacing down the glass. The aroma is overwhelmingly of bread (white bread). Taste is again bready barley malt, but some sweet hop spiciness is strong across the middles and end of the sip. It’s spicy, so-to-speak. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and San Miguel finishes crisp, refreshing, and a tad cloying. Overall, this is a pretty good, and certainly interesting beer. I’d say it’s worth trying.

RJT
Muy común en el sudeste asiático y Filipinas (donde la fabrican), como comenta alguno mas, quizás lo más interesante de esta cerveza sea el diseño de su botella. Por lo demás, poco que destacar.
The only thing good about this beer is, is the design of the bottle. Boring, slightly bitter aftertaste. Atypical Pils

Bottle. Light clear yellow with no head. Light hop bitterness that barely comes through in the aroma, but otherwise devoid of anything here. Flavor is a bit sweeter, with the hops nowhwere to be be found.  Light, crisp carbonation.  Not really all that drinkable ice cold even.

bottle.  Pours a very pale gold, with fizzy white head.  Actually not a horrible aroma, light crisp hops, rice, and a subtle stale corn.  Medium to light bodied, with a pretty dry finish, slightly bittered from hops, but stale corn also noticeable.  Overall it is a bland, uninteresting lager, yet it still puts most american macros to shame.

i taste ths beer in kathandu recently and this is not a pilsener beer.taste is not really different than it’s own san miguel lager.i hate the shape of the bottle also.In general i won’t go for this beer.sorry about that.i would go with tuborg,everest or coblenzer.

330 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a clear yellow/gold with with thin white head.  Sweet grainy malt and light grassy hops in aroma.  Taste is sweet and lightly grainy with a mild grassy hop finish.  Slightly metallic.  On the thin side.  Pretty weak.

Bottle.  Pours gold with thin fast dissipating white head.  Little Lacing.  Pleasant hay aroma, like a Pilsener but light.  Flavour starts out well, then goes into a clayey something with a metallic finish.  This is not a pilsener.

Bottle. Pours a clear, very pale gold with slightly rocky white head. Aroma is subtle but clean: soft notes of floral hops, honey, and a touch of corn. Flavor is similar in that it is subtle but clean. A nice, light blend of flowers, corn, and honey. I thought this was really good for what it was. Not a whole lot going on, but there is some nice balance to enjoy if you want to pay attention, and its subtle enough to ignore if you’re just there to down the beer.

Clear, pale yellow-golden with a tiny white head that’s gone in a flash. Smells like bread, sort of, and soapy water; basically a touch of sweet malt and corn with water. The taste is slightly sweet, extremely watery, chemical "enhanced," and rather offensive. Body is thin to non-existent, and the finish is really unnatural. I hate to say it, but I’d rather a Budweiser...Poor Phillipines. This really sucks for them.

Pours bright yellow with a mess of carbonation. smells like corn and eggs. Tastes like medium-sweet malt. Bites like a bad dog. I’m not sure that’s the Fillipino friendship San Miguel is talking about on the bottle. Save this one for a rainy day on the beach and draught yourself a pint of Guiness. At least the head stays until you’re done.
Earlier Rating: 6/5/2008 Total Score: 1.9
Draught pint at Cinta-J in Hong Kong. Pours clear yellow with lots of carbonation that doesn’t last long at all. Pure white head.  Corn sugar aroma. BLand, crappy hop flavor. Carbonated, bland finish. Nothing’s changed.

Bottle @ home. Pours a huge pearl white head with. Light golden yellow orange body. Sweet malty lager nose. Fairly basic pale malty body without the typical skunkiness of most Pale Lagers. Surprisingly fiull body with a basic pale malty body. Nice lager finish. Compared to most Pale Lagers, this is a refreshingly good beer.
12oz bottle pours pale yellow. Aroma is minimal hardly noticeable.  Taste is watery and body is light

12 oz. bottle my brother brought back from South Korea.  Pours a clear, pale yellow color with a small white head that leaves some large bubbles behind.  Aroma of grass, skunk, corn, straw, pale malts, and minerals.  The flavor follows suit for the most part but comes across as dryer and cleaner.  Light-bodied, with a dry, crisp mouthfeel and above average carbonation.  Not much going on here, but not as offensive as some of its peers.
Poured from bottle, pours a pale yellow with a thin head, hardly nothing on the nose and the taste is of corn and water, not for me.

Big corn flavors and watery aftertaste is what dominates this beer. This is probally awesome in some 90 degree humid bar in the south pacific, but standing alone on a cold night in Cali and it’s not that great.
Unofficial Dutch RB Meeting. Golden colored brew. Watery, sweet, grainy. Some bitterness in the end. Bad.
Bottle at Unofficial Dutch RB Meeting. Even more watery than the rest. Soapy and chemical. Evil spices in the finish. Very bad.

Bottle. Clear golden pour with a fluffy white head that lasts a little while. Aroma is grainy and grassy with a hint of cardboard. Flavour is quite subdued and identical to the aroma. Surprisingly thick, oily mouthfeel with low carbonation and a short, mildly bitter finish. Quite poor.

Pours light gold with streaming bubbles. transparent as can be. Biggish head at first that dissipates quickly. Smells of toasted grains. Very typical for the style. Tastes like a typical moderately crappy pale lager. Mehhh

Pours transparent blonde with a moderate white head. Nose is weak with some generic sweet malt, light hops, and a little skunk. Flavor is also weak and features a mostly hop-dominated flavor that’s not balanced at all by any real maltiness. Finish is tart. Not much here....typical pale lager.
12oz bottle: Appearance is golden brown with minimal white head, aroma of pale malt, flavor also pale malt with no distinct off flavors. Very drinkable but no real complexity here.

(bottle, 32cl) Clear, pale golden colour with a short foamy white head. Slightly sweet malty aroma with subtle citric and grainy notes. Moderately sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Shy grainy and slightly papery malty taste with traces of herbal hops far in the background; dry-ish finish with a whiff of herbal hops. Wow, almost drinkable after you have sampled Bintang, Saigon Export & Beerlao. 28.VIII.10
0.33 l can at Petalax Beer Festival 2010, thanks Timo A! Golden color. Appley and grainy aroma. Dryish grainy taste with some stale maltiness.
Verzuurd, geen hop te bekennen, karton en karamel. Dit was het oordeel van ons select gezelschap. Opnieuw een bewijs dat pils jong moet zijn, al zal dit spul wel nooit een prijsbeest geweest zijn.
Light yellow, good head.  Taste like another pilsener / lager with a bit of a citrus or light pine hit to it.  Ok, but not great.
Pours a pale yellow color with a small white foamy head.  Smells of malts and skunk.  Tastes of malts.  Light and crisp.  Better than expected!

Bottle. Poured light golden amber colour, with a thin head, but retention was very poor and thin. The aroma at first is all citrus but no hops are prominant. The taste does not have much malt character at all,  the bitterness was slightly dull just a lot of citrus flavours going on here although quite crisp its very watered down with not much flavour.

Bottle. Golden pour, medium head. Aroma is faint malt and hop.
Flavour is refreshing balance between bitter and sweet, hints of corn syrup, grains. Definite lawnmower, but walking around here in the Philippines is too much effort already so it’s nice every time. Nice silk screened bottle.
It’s golden with a white head. The aroma is weak with light notes of malt and fruit. The flavour is mild/thin with light notes of malt, fruit and citrus and the finish is slightly spicy.
Bottle. Somewhere in Hong Kong. Awful. Negligible aroma. Does not deliver on pleasant appearance - golden with substantial white head. Flavour extremely off-putting. Never again.
Pours clear pale yellow with white head and some lacing.  Faint hop aroma.  Faint beer taste.  The best you can say is that it is wet.

640 ML bottle in Thailand. A usual macro lager taste and aroma. Nothing special or commendable about it. I suppose my perception would changed since I was drinking it under the hot sun on a beach. Inoffensive and better than some of the other macro lagers out there.
Got no aroma off this.  It is alright: not good, not bad, just sort of there.  About what a pale lager would be.  Better on a hot day, not as drinkable as some in the class, but better than Genny!
Pours golden to a medium bodied white head. Has a faint fruity aroma to it and is smooth on the palate. Doesn’t have an unpleasant aftertaste. Not a bad beer.
(bottle) clear light golden colour, medium head; aroma is sweetish, malty, bit skunky; simple, generally balanced flavour - not outright bad but not inviting second try

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a golden color with a minimal white head.  Aroma of corn, malt, and a bit of skunk.  About what I expected for a foreign lager.  Fairly easy on the palate.  LIght bodied.  Nothing special.
Bottle from supermarket in Amsterdam. Golden body with medium head. Nose is corny and hops. Flavour is quite basic of hops. Watery. Some sweetness. Okay.

Bottle: Poured a golden color lager with a medium size bubbly head with average retention for the style. Aroma of light adjunct with sweet notes is more or less pleasant. Taste is very similar to most cheap lager out there with loads of corn and other adjunct which provide a sweet malt backbone. Not worth drinking on a regular basis.

0,32 literes üvegből kiöntve kóstolva. Szép hab és ehhez illő aranyos test. Kiöntés után az üvegben maradó hab óriáspókháló szerű buborékokat képez.
Illata kellemes gyümölcsös, gabonás. Kóstoláskor a komló enyhén, de rögtön megjelenik, s egyre édesebben, de végig érezhető. A maláta alig, inkább a pörkölése érezhető egy kissé. A megjelenése alapján jobbra számítottam.

Poured from bottle. Nose is mostly beery, but there are some faint citrus and resin notes. Pours a clear yellow with a surprisingly robust head. While the taste is mostly typical fizzy yellow stuff, there is some decent hops bitterness on the close. Palate is forgettable. For a session beer, it would be bearable; on a hot day, it would be acceptable, or even welcome.

Bottle 33 cl. Thanks to AZLondon for this one! Golden, clear with a small white head. Aroma; Malty with some sence of straw. Taste; Very mild sweet malty. Nothing spes. but fun to have tried a  Philippines beer.
A pale golden beer with a huge slowly dissipating head. Interesting one of the first beers I’ve had that has no aroma at all. The taste was like milled grain.

Bottled (from bierzwerg.de). Pale yellowish golden colour with mediumsized bubbly white head, that disappears quite quickly. Aroma is cooked vegetables, maizelike sweetness as well as some slight grains and mild metallic notes. Flavour is maizelike sweetness, some earth, mild cooked vegetables and grains. Not the worst of lagers...

15/03 A 0.32 l bottle brought home from Asian store in Mitte, Berlin. It poured golden body with medium sized head. Some hay and corn, so typical pale lager aroma. Sweetish corny flavor, very simple and watery with short finish that showed up some herbal bitterness, not really the best one. Nothing too bad here, but dull and easily forgettable. At least new country for me!
It’s golden with a white head. The aroma is weak with light notes of malt and fruit. The flavour is mild/thin with light notes of malt, fruit and citrus and the finish is slightly spicy.

[Bottle] Clear yellow pour with a foamy white head. Sweet and grainy aroma. Some wet hay and grass character in there. Sweet grainy and honey flavor with some metal in the aftertaste. Light hints of bitterness in the finish. It could have been worse, I guess.

Bottled.  Poured clear straw golden with a short-lived white head.  The aroma picked up a very strong hit of sweetened-up honey and corn with even more sweetness around.. a little bit of garbage backing as it warmed up.. never smelled anything like it, and I’d rather not again.  The flavor (yeah, I drank it) took a few seconds to get going, but the same huge, sweet, nasty mash of corn and honey amped up by carbonation eventually showed at the middle.. not much bitterness to note.. some vanilla and stale pale malts joined, especially with warmth.. finished with some tartness along with the nasty, over-bearing sweetness.  Light-bodied and tacky on the palate.. it seemed like all the ugly stuff stuck where it shouldn’t, while any small hint of redeeming character slid right by.

12 ounce bottle from Total Wine, Richmond, VA. I’m thankful this is in a brown bottle. Pours a very clear very pale yellow color. Large frothy head sticks around a while but has poor lacing. Aroma of sweet malts with a nutty, faintly grassy finish. Taste is cloyingly sweet artificial seeming malts, honey and a faint grassy finish. Thin-medium bodied. I could probably choke this down but it would be such an unenjoyable experience that down the drain it goes.

can, courtesy of Tony @ OTH.
pours golden, white head.
aroma mostly pale malts, some wheat and sweetness.
flavor, wheat and plenty of pale malts, light bitter hops. Where the whole beer falls short is in the clear indication of starch added to the mix. A quick way to ruin everything with chemically altered corn.

Pour from a 12 oz bottle. Pale yellow beer with a fizzy white head. Active carbonation. Weak aroma of faint malt and hops – does not smell bad. Flavor is on the weak side, a hint of malt, a slightly bitter and sour finish. Mouthfeel is less watery than I’d expect from the looks. Inoffensive but not much here. It has been years since I had this and in my memory it was better.
Sweet malt, cereal, and grain aroma and flavour. Golden with no head.  Light body with dry finish.

7/11/09 from a 12 oz bottle. Aroma is very malt forward, pils swet/ sour dominated, with no dms. Appearance is clear yellow with no head. Flavor is very watery sour malt with medium-high noble bittering.  Mouthfeel is low bodied with a medium-high carb texture. Overall, so-so.

12oz can brought straight from the Philippines from a girl at work.  Clear carbonated pour.  Golden wheat yell pour with a light fluffy head.  Sharp aroma with grain dominating.  Lite lager heaven ;-)  Lightly bitter in a spice like way but also grain astringency.  Grainy flavors swimming in water.  Nothing particularly bad but certainly not good either.  Generally light body with a slightly dry finish.  Not near as bad as I imagined.
Oh look another bright yellow beer with no head. Metalic mouthfeel, blah!!!

Bottle with dinner at an eatery in Hippietown North.  Pale and somewhat bland, it complimented the tuna melt.  Some funky spice tones in the second half of body.  Passable but just.  Probably great with spicy foods.
Poured a pale clear yellow with a white, quickly dissipating head. Brewed in Thailand. Not offensive, but not so good either.
Definitely a pale lager, but with more flavor than one normally gets out of these quaffers. Interesting banana notes. Nothing else noteworthy, but definitely drinkable.

(bottle - 12 oz) Clear gold with a thick and fizzy white head. Aroma is light and corny with some dry bitterness and grass. Flavor is dry and bitter at the beginning with a stale grassy middle and a very dry and lingering bitterness. Tastes like an international pale lager.
On the same lines as Kalik,Modelo,and Corona. Light golden color with no aroma really. Sort of a salty taste but I might like this one better then all the others.

(br-btl gl-lbl, "Pale Pilsner",  I think it’s also brewed in Indo where I got it)



lucent gold, high co2, medium body,  bitter §diacetyl T1T2; bitter hoppy §spicy T3; not much pils taste.
Golden color. Crisp. Refreshing especially on the first swig. Not bitter. Smooth.
Bottle, in Hoi An. Decent head retention on a golden beer. Aroma is grassy and apply. Flavors are also apply. Some floral hops detected. Not as bad as expected.

30th July 2008. Bottle from the Philippines. This generally is poor from anywhere else! Pale gold lager. Light and crisp. Watery but in a refreshing spritzer sort of way. Refreshing. A beer close to my heart as I drank loads of it in the Philippines. Sometimes even had this for breakfast when the water was suspect.

33cl Bottle bought at a Carrefour in Bandung, brewed by PT Delta Jakarta Indonesia. ABV 4,54%. Clear golden colour, fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet, cereal, bread. Flavour is very sweet, corn, cereal, no bitterness whatsoever. Light to medium bodied. Not so good.

Years ago I had this beer, and it was a favorite of mine. It was creamy, with a very nice malt-hop balance. Maybe slightly more bitter than many lagers back then, but very good.
Sad to say, time has not been kind to the San Miguel coming to our shores now a day. 
Not much nose to speak of. Slightly winey, almost like what you’d expect if a beer were produced with a wine yeast. Dull flavor, like a weak cream soda with hops in it. Not sure if the recipe has changed drastically, or if it’s simply a sign of the times and less expensive malt and hops are being used, but this is not a beer that would appear on my "wish list."

This beer is brewed for HOT climates, to properly enjoy this beer the temperature must be at least 30c with high humidity.  Anything less will negatively impact your enjoyment.

Beer was drank straight from the bottle so no head or color inspection done.  Mouthfeel is great, this beer has an amazing thirst quenching ability.  Slight pleasant after-taste that lingers a bit too long.

This beer is a staple while traveling in the Philippines.
When I found this at a Philippino karaoke bar in Fort Worth, I had low expectations.  They were exceeded.  Not by much, but hey.

Eons ago drank loads of the pale pilsen version of this while I was in the Navy at our home away from home, Subic Bay, Philippines. We always got hangovers which we called the "San Magoo Blues". This one Poured with a small white head and no lace. Color is a very pale yellow and super clear. Aroma is generic world beer. Flavor’s about the same and corn sweetened. Body’s ok but feels like force carbonation. Some laces shows up towards the bottom of the glass. Finish is blah. Don’t plan on finishing the beer.
Straw blonde, lacy head. Pilsen and corn malt aroma with light graininess. Flavor is similarly lightly grainy with packets of corn and malting, but it finishes watery and estery.

Bottle 32cl. @ home.
Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20090712]

Philippino "pale pilsen" version, bought from a grocery store in the metro DC area.  Very typical lager with no redeeming qualities.  Image any other lager of the developing world and this one is no different.  Life is too short.
A strictly average swill that had a decent colour and a fairly good head.  Aroma not offensive but the taste/flavour was forgettable.  I’d drink it again if nothing better was available.
Had this on a couple occasions in Hong Kong.  Beer is light with grainy notes.  Some hops.  Refreshing.
Pours a fading white head with a clear straw color body.  Smells of cheap grain and a hint of hops.  Flavor typical.

Single bottle into a glass. Golden pee with a big loose white head that goes away immediately. Aroma is sweet corn and fruits that leads to a big sweet flavor with touches of metal and dust. Over sweet and not very good.
Bottle. I tried this in Malaysia. Another terrible macro. Has very little hops, sweet malt and an unpleasant soapy, sour character. No thanks.
Your typical largely drinkable pale lager. Perhaps a little acidic. Light, small hops, crisp bitterness.
gold blond coloured body with a white head a spicy malty aroma a malty spicy sweet wattery taste with a bitter finish
Clear pale yellow pour with a nice white head. Malt, slightly sweet, a little light in flavor and aftertaste. A little watery. Laced the glass.
Pours clear pale yellow with a thin white head. Really not much to say here... aroma is nonexistent. Flavor is very light, a little skunk, some malt sweetness. Weak, boring, but not offensive.

Bottle. Light notes of grain, grass, paper and vinegar. Head is small, frothy which settled to wispy, white with a scant bit of lacing and is almost fully diminishing. Color is sparkling clear light amber. Flavor starts slightly sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and slightly bitter. Palate is light to medium, dry and has a lively carbonation. A typical Pale Lager with a little bit of weight to it. Not bad.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with medium creamy white mostly lasting head. Malty aroma. Sweet flavor. Bitter finish.

Probably gold.  Smell is malty and a bit light and watery.  Taste is fairly dry and crisp with a faint malt and yeast flavor in the finish.  Mostly crisp, watery and cleanish with a slight off flavor.  Decent

Bottle from Steph’s sister in an international multipack.  Clear straw color with small white head.  Aroma is slighty grainy, slightly lager yeasty.  Flavor is very similar but dryer.  Medium highly carbonated body.  Standar import lager.

Overall Impression: 
You see this one around, it’s pretty boring, but not the worst thing I have ever had.  Weak and boring...
Earlier Rating: 7/9/2009 Total Score: 1.8
Overall Impression: 
This is another one of those random foreign pale lagers that are watery, weak, and dull.  Hot day, quick drink, not much else...

Bottle as shown in Cayman Islands. Pours a clear golden with a medium frothy white head. The aroma is wheat grass and corn malt. Thin mouthfeel and a bit watery on the palate with a sour corn malt. Not much going on with this pale lager.

A clear, pale yellow gold brew with a sort of white head and zero lacing. The first thing to come to mind on the aroma was manure but that did fade quickly. Whats left over is ok malts, something smoky (????wtf?), some sweetness...comes across weak. The taste is dry and grainy with a little sweetness but is just below your average for flavour. Thin bodied, empty and too gassy. Finishes mild with an acceptable ammount of bitterness.
Pale yellow with medium head, aroma of grass vegies and some malt, flavor is sweet malty with some mint and soap, bitter finish. Bad Beer

12 oz bottle... a personal favorite of mine more because of the atmosphere when i am drinking them... at first taste i am reminded of my friends filipino backyard pig roasts, and manny paqiyaou fights... easy drinking and always a good time
Light yellow and clear. Has a white head, mostly diminishing. Aroma is light malty, light bread and light hoppy. Flavor starts light sweet and finish moderate bitter. Dry, watery texture.

Appearance: Light golden, good amount of white head.
Aroma: Grains, some malt. Not much else.
Taste: Quite sweet, some malt. No hops. Watery.
Info: 320ml bottle, 19/5-2009
clear yellow, standard mega beer from/for one country almost notihing flavor wise to talk about, just "a" beer, unimpressive in every way

Bottle pours a crystal clear, pale yellow color with a foamy white head.  Grassy hop, grain aroma.  Not much flavor.  There’s a slight sweetness, but almost no aftertaste.  Light and eay to drink, but I would pass this one over in a heartbeat for something with more flavor and character.
Pours a golden color with a white head.  Aroma is of grains, grass, and floral hops.  Flavor is pretty much the same with a little bit of a crisp finish.  Nothing special.
Bottle. Pours a very clear yellow with a nice sized white head. Aroma of bread. Very thin tasting with some fruit and malts. Not very flavorful, but very easy to drink.

Bottle in Texas.  Glad this was handed to me and I did not pay for it.  I just can’t figure out why people keep cranking out these sub-standard pale lagers.  I guess they at least put it in a brown bottle compared to green.

Dusty soapy aroma. Aggressively carbonated with a thin corny backbone. A slight bit of grassy hop bitterness in the aftertaste. Pours a nice clear golden yellow with a mid-sized white head. Decent lacing. Run of the mill.
Decent beer but doesn’t have much else going for it.  Tastes like a standard golden.
Pours clear yellow gold. Decent head. Sweet apple aroma. Tastes pretty wheaty.

Thinly malted with too much hops + bitterness. The carbonation is an overkill. It’s like a pale bitter soapy bubbly soda pop that drags itself across your tongue and claws its way down your throat, with 5% alcohol thereabouts thrown in.

0.33L bottle,  clear light gold colour, fizzyhead with big bubbles, extremely strong carbonation. Strong malty atoma with skunky notes creeping in the back. Strong sour corny taste, with light mettalic notes, almost no bitterness, extremely, the sourness lingers on to the finish with a dry unpleasant sensation.
Bottle.  Pours golden yellow with a fizzy white head. Smells a little skunky, but malty and a little corny.  Tastes corny and grainy, sorta earthy.  Not too bad.

ersma: mein land nr. 29. 
mittelpilsige farbe mit ordentlichem schaum. 
geruch ist dominant süßlich malzig. erinnert an lager, aber weckt keine pils-assoziationen. 
antrunk dumpf, hopfig. zur mitte gemischt. sehr herb und gleichzeitig sehr malzig. den abgang dominiert der hopfen. recht süffig. 
sehr eigenwillige bedruckte flasche, die in den vortests hinreichend beschrieben wurde. nur auf den inhalt möchte ich nochmals verweisen: 0.32 l... 
fazit: wenns papain als stabilisator braucht und das ganze eher nach lager schmeckt, sollte man sich den konservierungsstoff sparen und gleich ein lager brauen.

12 oz. single - $1.49 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

San Miguel well well, what have we here?

Appearance: Pours a crystal clear, yellow body with a smallish, snow white head. It looks nice, for a lager. Perhaps we should just stop there.

Smell: Sweetish, faintly grainy cereal aroma with a tiny, simple note of green apple peelings.

Taste: Light, cereal sweet, grainy maltiness. Incredibly minor taste of green apples. Hint of rice. Only enough basic, spicy Noble hop bitterness for balance. Finishes dry and very abrupt.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: It’s pretty acceptable considering it is just a simple lager. You could certainly do far, far worse when it comes to this style.
33 cL can, courtesy of faeroeviking. Pours clear and yellow with a small white head. Mild malty and slight dry aroma. Mild malty and cornish flavoured. Mild bitter finish.

I’m surprised my review brought it over 1. This has a large, but quickly diminishing head and a light golden color. Very little separates this from the bad American Macros- weak, watery flavor only offering hints of corn and metal. I regret buying this, but if I were in the Philippines, it might taste better.

Among other places, found this bottled in Stevens Point, Wisconsin.  Crystal clear, light yellow pour with a very thick, foamy off-white head, a faint nose of canned corn, typical of the style, not really worth it.  Light and uninteresting.

Bottle from Total Wine on 09/01/2008. Clear pale golden body with a medium frothy white head. Pale malt and some cereal aroma with some very faint hops. Cereal and honey flavor, some pale malts and some almost spicy hops in the background. Medium light body with moderately high carbonation.
Bottle. Pours a yellow gold. Light malt and grain flavors. Good amount of effervescence. OK beer for a day at the beach.

330ml single from the LCBO Stop Pours a clear gold with a small white cap Stop Smells of corn, tinny hops and coldness Stop Tastes like tinny hops and corn Stop Very dry in the finish from the tinny hops Stop Makes me want to type my ratings telegraph style with no periods Stop pretty uninteresting but not nearly as awful as I was worried it might be Stop Seems like they might have actually used real hops here Stop And at least it’s not skunky Stop Glad I did not purchase entire 6 pack Stop All together not offensive and borderline enjoyable Stop
Man another crap beer that was a get together of guys last night.  Yellow pour, medium head.   Smells like corn, bland malts and it just stinks.  flavor is boring, not worth the time to drink.  yuck.

12oz bottle.   Clear yellow body with a decent head.   Corn-flakes, herbal hops, and overall not-perfectly-fresh lager aromas.   Light pale malt flavors, with a bit of lemon and a slight skunkage/cheesy element.   Light and crisp mouthfeel, also a bit slick.   Definitely shows some staleness, but I think this would be perfectly tolerable fresh, on its home turf.
I never realized this was from the Phils, but that doesn’t make it taste any better.  Light yellow with a small head and a watered down beer.

Bottle.  Pours a clear light gold with a 2 finger fluffy white head but very spotty lacing results.  Nose is grains and honey.  Taste is caramel malt upfront, with light grassy hops and sweet corn in the finish.  Lighter mouth feel.  Tastes like a dime a dozen foreign lagers.  Drinkable beer, no real faults, pretty boring.  I did get to check off the Philippines after it though.
bottlw.bit of a fruity scent. pale yellow with decent head and lots of carbonation. very smooth with not much bite. overall its ok.
Pours gold with a full head. A tad bit of sweet fruits and wheat...and that’s what passes for a palate.
Slightly maltier than expected, but balanced by a little hops.  Smooth, but somewhat tasteless.  Little skunk there at the end, reminds me of a sweeter Heineken Light, eh.

Product of Philippines. 12 oz bottle Total Wine. Aroma of European pale malts, touch of spicy earthy hops. Clear light straw with moderate fine white head.
Flavor follows aroma with moderate bitterness. Light body with medium mouthfeel. Finish is moderately dry but not crisp.

Bottled(320ml). -bought in China supermarket on the ship docked near Euromast tower in Rotterdam.

Yellow coloured, medium sized airy white head that went away, dusty cereals and rice nose. Tastes like sparkling mineral water with notes of rice and corn. Watery palate, bitterish finish. Typical Asian industrial beer.
Clear, Clean, Dry and Golden... Creamy white head...  Good memories with this beer in the Philippines....  not recommended for cool places...

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass.AU17/08.



App.:  Clear golden with a nice white meringue.
  
Aroma:  Strong sweet apple cider, light straw, a touch of cereal, a bit of pear and maybe some DMS?
  
Palate:  Medium body and carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Lots of the sweet apple cider and pear juice, light straw, a touch of grassy hops, a little cardboard; almost dry with almost no bitterness and a clean finish.



What is Tagalog for “You can keep your crappy apple juice beer”?
Given that this came in a "tall boy," I wasn’t expecting much. Still, it was a serviceable but absolutely ordinary beer.
Well, it’s definitely a pale lager. Clear gold with a thin white head. Grassy nose. Flavor is weak, watery, lagery malt. Nothing much to recommend here.

Pale golden coloured body with a thinnish white head and very little else of importance. Gross cardboardie malt aroma with some yeast and fake sugar. Light-bodied; Strong hop taste up front fading to a stale malt backbone and very little else. Aftertaste shows effervescence and a tiny bit of caster sugar - aside from that, nothing. Overall, FINALLY nice to try during the olympics, but aside from the cache of the purchase, not a good beer! I sampled this  500 mL KING CAN, purchased from a small shop in Hong Kong, SAR China last year, sampled in August 2008.

Pours a light straw coloured gold. Thin and disappearing bright white head. Aroma is plain, boring and skunky. The flavour is slightly corny, grassy, and hints of floral hops. Light bodied lager with slighty unpleasant aftertaste. Would never purchase again.

Pours a pale gold with tiny white head. Aroma and flavour are about the same; Corn, malts. Some grassy notes. Dry, and slightly bitter finish. I didn’t mind it at all, but I don’t see a point in buying it again.

Don’t know if this is the same beer as other people are rating, but this was a 330ml bottle imported. Nice crisp aroma, bit of malt. Flavour has a nice malt body, with some definate bitter hops. Very drinkable and refreshing.
Nice pale lager.  Smell was very crisp and clean.  Poured a great clear golden color.  Really nice beer on a hot day, and not shabby as far as this style goes.
Clear and golden in color with nice brussels lace.  Smell starts Skunky but finishes fine.  Clean and dry beer.  Good balance with the hops and malts.
Poured a straw color with a weak white head. Aroma was of corn, grass and sweet malt. Flavor was very sweet with a slight skunky hint. Blah.
Pours gold with a thin whit head.  Smells malty and earthy.  Tastes peppery and basic with not a lot going on.
Bottle 32 cl. Pours a pale golden with a small white head and an unpleasant aroma of cardboard. The taste is very watered down, with grains and maybe some hops. Not good

Pours such a clear and light color I can read my computer monitor through it.  Nice big white head that lasts a couple of minutes.  Rice adjuncts in the aroma.  A distinct dry bitterness sets this beer somewhat apart from so many others.  In this style little distinctions  must go a long way.  Another boring pale lager.

(Bottle) Perfectly drinkable for a macro lager.  Better than many of the American macros...but lagging behind many of the other foreign macro lagers.  Too sweet...my main criticism.  A little bit of macro-sourness is present.  Could be a lot worse though.
Nice clear color with a fine white head. on the lighter side still satifying. Small Malt and carmel.
Not sure what I can positive about this beer.  It’s a pale lager in every sense of the word.  Very astringent – I can’t get how people like to drink this stuff.
pours golden bubbly with small white head.Flavor is malty with almost a hint of caramel.Aroma doesnt matter cuz its faint and barely identifiable.

VERY clear. Nice thick head. You can really see the carbonation coming up from the bottom of the glass. Nice light lager. Fresh malty flavor. Some hops, but not anything that stands out at first pout. However, there is more hop character after its warmed up a little.. I honestly don’t understand the low ratings on this. Sure, its not going to stand up to the Heinikens or the Pilsner Urquels, but its a heck of a lot more fresh and flavorful,. IMHO, than things like Bud and Miller (It actually reminds me of Coors, which is one of the only American premiums, I will drink).

Pours clear golden. thin white head, scattered lacing. rice, corn and very grainy. not a lot of flavor, very watery. not dissapointing, because i never had my hopes up.
Earlier Rating: 5/18/2008 Total Score: 1.8
Pours a bright clear yellow colour, small thin white head. plenty of carbonation, aroma was weak, straw and pears. taste was rather grainy and watery.

Yeasty, slightly hoppy nose.  Clear, pale golden color with respectable white head.  Light bodied and a light hop taste with heavy carbonation.  Lots of water, mostly bland.  Dry, crisp, salty finish.
Watery and incomplete, this beer is OK in that typical Mexican-beer sort of way - to wash down food. It is better than some, but not recommended.
Can. Medium head with medium duration. Color is pale yellow. Aroma and taste are mild malt with slight notes of hops. Watery.
Putangina Napakasarap ng beer na ito. Ina nyo mga gago. This beer is alright
Slightly corny/ricey aroma.  Flavor is pretty much non-existent.  Not terribly offensive, but there is no real reason to drink it.

Sparkling golden color with white head.  Nice appetizing aromas of sweet grain and malt.  Light bodied with good carbonation.  Sweet malty taste with gentle hop finish.  Very refreshing and versatile, try with roasted lechon or a hearty bowl of Philipino-style menudo.

Very nutered pilsner. Looks fine in the glass, but everything else is made so as few people as possible dislike it. No surprises and no hidden secrets.

Easily forgotten...

12 oz. Pale gold with a small ring of  foam that lasts. Honey and grain aroma. Flavor is almost like a good crisp pizza crust or white  saltine cracker, slight honey, and some tart apple. Light-medium body is a little smooth, a little frothy, and a little dry. Pretty drinkable.
12 fl oz bottle. moderatley hoppy. medium to dark yellowish pour. slight sweetness and slight bitterness. body is light texture somewhat dry. not bottom of the barrel but just a plain ol lager.

33cl bottle
Ah the original.  Plain ol’ basic lager.  Again, it’s so damn hot in the Philippines that really cold piss would probably be OK.  This is a slightly better choice.
Earlier Rating: 4/27/2008 Total Score: 2
33cl bottle
At the Hard Rock in Manila.  Not drastically different from the other San Mig beers.  Drinkable on a warm Philippine night, but not great.
typical lager look, nose of grains, and grass. flavour is grainy. and grassy, a tiny bit of malt, meh.....pretty middle of the road, and boring.

12 ounce bottle-  slightly darker in appearance than typical for a lager.  Fair, stark white head.  Aroma was as expected from a lager.  There was a very high carbonation level that may have contributed to the light, somewhat sweet taste of the beer, nice mouth feel.  A fine beer for hot day activities or with spicey foods.  Enjoyed it.

Bottle. Cheap tasting beer at a premium price. Reminds me of Schlitz. Color - yellow. Taste - cheap. Smell - skunk.
Would not recommend.
Clear and golden in color with nice brussels lace.  Smell starts Skunky but finishes fine.  Clean and dry beer.  Good balance with the hops and malts.

12 oz bottle. Pours a little darker yellow then most lagers and has a good head for a lager. Hints of citrus over a corny? grassy smell.  If you like lager it has has a richer taste then most. For us who do not prefer lagers this will not change your mind.
Bottle. Simple Asian lager with some malty sweetness added. Clean golden color. Decent hot weather offering

Bottle. Pours golden with dense head, medium size. Aroma has some grassy and herbal hoppiness, light corn syrup in the background. Flavor is doughy, light herbal bitterness, but also a little artificial-tasting sweetness and adjunct grain flavors. Unfortunately, these off-flavors begin to dominate as it warms. Finish has lasting pleasant mild bitterness.
Earlier Rating: 12/22/2006 Total Score: 2.4
10.8 oz. bottle in Taiwan. Golden color, dissipating white head. Excellent beer when extremely fresh, and very fresh bottles are available in this part of the world. Aroma is citrusy and malty. Taste is Slightly bitter hops, yeast and malt. A little buttery green apple flavor as well. Very little adjunct flavor. Tastes even better on tap. Easy drinking, with enough flavor to kept it interesting.
Bottle, pours a very clear yellow color, with a thin head, slight metallic hops, not bad better than quite a few euro macros and better than most US Macros.

Phase, SE Asian or Phillipino, not bad for a piss beer, stale tasting, better than the normal american type of mass consumption brew a bit hoppier but still mostly stale, flat and quick to lose carbonation.
Bought the 1000ml bottle at a little shop in the Philippines.  Pretty easy to drink, no foul odors or flavors.  On the other hand it is just another pale lager.  I prefer SM’s Red Horse to this.

12 oz bottle poured into lager glass- poured transparent golden yellow, white head quickly bubbled away, medium carbonation.  Aroma of malt and corn.  Hits the mouth with a thin body, malt is very weak, some corn sweetness can be noticed in the mouth after the finish.
A light golden beer with a small head. This is a very easy to drink beer and very enjoyable in the Philippines. I will always tie this pale lager to great memories!
Pours like a standard macro lager.  There’s really nothing to describe here.  More of the same...

Bottle. Pours a pale greenish yellow with a big white head. The aroma is tons of corn, almost exactly like cheap taco shells; behind that, there is a strange, slightly unpleasant spiciness. The flavor is weaker than the aroma, but is still dominated by corn. Mellow sweetness throughout, with a touch of herbal hops in the finish. I’ll be cooking with the rest of this bottle.

Found this beer here in Japan. I don’t really expect too much from this one but I guess we’ll see. Pours out a golden yellow color with a fairly decent white head. Aroma is sweeter than expected as the malts produce a smell of hay or straw. Taste is subltle and thin. A touch of sweet hay and fruitiness followed by a gentle bittering of hops. Very drinkable beer and nothing offensive at all. Better than most macro pale lagers so that has to count for something. Not bad, even a bit more alcohol than your average pale lager to boot.
(Philippines) Light beer with small Head and yellow color!!  Taste is ok, Not much to get excited about.
light golden color. smells of adjuncts corn and rice. decent yeasty taste muddled with corn. not the best lager I ever had but much better than I expected.
Bottle.  Plain pale yellow in color, decent head, slightly acidic skunky aroma and flavor.  Very light body.  Odd aftertaste of copper pennys.  Not very good.

Re-rate 4/13: Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Ariel. Slightly grainy, slightly bitter. Pretty clean. 3/2/4/2/8=1.9



Bottle. A yellow beer with a quickly-diminishing medium white head. Sweetish cereal aroma. Sweetish and adjuncty flavor, with faint hints of bitterness in the finish. Very thin and light bodied. Very little flavor in this beer, but it’s also quite clean and there’s nothing very offensive about it. At least I kind of like the label design. 3/2/3/1/5=1.4
Ubiquitous pale yellow appearance. Friendly attitude. Medium carbonation. Good example of a well mannered pale lager. Passable finish and it does not offend. Not as good as their dark brew.

Light Gold beer, decent amount of thin head. Doesn’t smell like much, very light scent of Corn. Taste is immediately stronger than I thought it would be considering the smell. Kind of Metallic, what do you know, another bad lager! I’d pass on this one if given to me again.

[670-20070923] Tap @ Alibi (Bristol, BR). Mild yeasty aroma. Clear, pale orange yellow body with quick white bubbles. Typical vegetable base flavour with a yeasty aftertaste. Clean light body. Not unpleasant but wanting.

330ml bottle 

5.0% ABV 

I tried this beer on October 30, 2007 at "Smokeless Joe’s" in Toronto.  The beer poured a pale translucent gold with a thin white head.  The aroma was slightly hoppy with a citrusy background.  The mouthfeel was very thin with very high carbonation.  The flavour was a mixture of malt, grass, and lemons.

I remember when I drank this the notes say okay drink but it had a herbal taste that blots out the taste of the bitter and malt.Great colour pils weak head though and the taste of the herbs spoilt it.Aroma was mild because of it.
Bottle.  Body is a fizzy gold that leaves a bit of a head.  Aromas are of sweet malt and floral hops.  Flavor is decent, even if it is rather uninspiring.  Peppery and grassy hops are the highlight.
Light to Medium Flavor, nice bottle, very classic, highly recommended beer! should be served very cold.

330ml bottle. 

Pours a sparkling golden yellow with a large white head thats fades quickly but leaves a ring of foam. Aroma of apples and grains. Flavour is similar. Tart with a grassy, semi-bitter finish. Pretty simple beer. Average lager. Would probably like this more on a beach in Mexico.

This is a decent pale lager.  It is somewhat more flavourful than many but also a little more unpleasant, with a faint funky element that is almost off-putting.  It is light gold with a a fairly thick white head.  The aroma is standard grain and bread but with a faint pleasant quality like tar.  The taste is ok, having more flavour than Schlitz or Budweiser but, despite being mostly similar, it has a mild inpleasant quality as well.  This is not reall off-putting, but almost is.
Pale yellow with medium white head. Typical aromas of a pale lager- weak and grainy. Flavour was much the same. Just ok.
Fizzy like a soda. Not really a good beer. Light colored without flavor. Very watery. Nothing special about it.

As unsatisfying as a beer can get. Pours a clear yellow with no head, just some fizz. Aroma is thick and sweet, and sour, like a can of corn gone bad. Flavours of water, water, some water, some carbon dioxide, and a touch of hop pellets. Oh well, atleast I can add the Philippines to my list. I’m going to down this and grab a real beer out of the fridge.
its ok, pale straw color not much flavor almost pretty decent but no would be good on a hot hot day

Can bought in a supermarket in London’s Chinatown.
Not much of a body, but a crisp hoppiness makes this a decent refreshement.

Can that my wife brought back from the Philippines. Clear pale-yellow color with a medium head. Very sweet with malt and corn and just a bit of grassy hops. A little sweeter than most, and a bit more malt flavor. Just not so much as to make it hunt-able.
Pale yellow, with a faint aroma and a slightly, malty flavor.  Was not too impressed with this one.  At least it was fairly inexpensive.
typical lager, bit of a skunky flaavor and aroma, best thing about this beer is that a six pack is only $3.00 bucks other than that eh

320ml bottle that looks like it’s survived both world wars both considering the design and the wear on it, brought from Switzerland by a friend (thanks Ivana!)
 Darj yellow going golden body with almost no head... nose... rice, some fruity maltiness. Ugh. Light medicinal flavour, rice, medicine, cardboard, weak maltiness, and if I stretch my imagination, a note of hops. Pleasant, silky mouthfeel, but the taste is ugly. Drinkable, but still crap. Still, it’s my first beer from the Philippines.
12oz bottle.  Golden yellow.  Fizzy white head.  Skunky lager aroma.  Malt body, sharp bitter finish.  Light bodied.
12 ounce bottle purchased at World Market Pembroke Pines, FL $1.69 Nothing special
This beer is crap. nasty flat taste with piss yellow color. only buy this is it is the only beer at the store...even then contemplate drinking a juice box instead....blah blah :(

Poured a light, clear, golden color with a rather thin head. The nose was light, grainy and slightly fruity. The taste is malty and lemony. Citric and pine bitterness is noticable, the finish is light and malty. Its a simple beer, not to complicated which gives it a moderate level of drinkability. Not my first, second or third pick; but it will do in a pinch.

clear pale gold pour and a medium dense white head. lightly acidic corn aroma with a hint of floral hops. light watery body and crisp lively carbonation that is almost harsh. very little flavor, some corn and sweet malt. flavor is too light even for a pale lager.
Very light and watery.  Great going down on a hot day.  Not very strong flavored.  Has a little taste.
gold color, nice malt taste, very nice in warm weather and drink it very cold
Nothing really unique here, other than it being from the Philippines. And my name is Phil. Does that mean something?
330 ml bottle - pale gold pour.  Sweet corn aroma.  Tastes the same.  Nothing interesting to speak of.  Thin and weak, just like me. Could be any one of a hundred different import lagers.
Pours golden yellow with a tall white head. Balanced on the malt side, light honey notes and straw finish. Hops are faint. Decent middle of the road inexpensive pale lager.

Dog days of summer scream for lagers and this one turned out to be pretty decent. Pale golden-yellow color, 1" fluffy head, and decent lacing. Neutral grainy aroma not very exciting. Light bodied with a great drinkability. Crisp maltiness along with a faint sweet aftertaste. Base is of a standard lager flavor, noticeable malt with an underlying caramel sweetness. No detectable hops althought the beer is nicely balanced. Nothing wrong with this one.

Clear, bright gold appearance with a small white head and no lacing.  Muted aroma dominated by corn flakes.  Non descript, cardboard -like taste with a light touch of sweet malt.  A good reason to think globally but drink locally (unless you live in the Philippines).

Excellentlooking beer - clear gold with a substantial white head. Hoppy aroma  jumps out and grabs you.  Specific smell is a refed woody, raw hop aroma. Flavour is grassy hop with  a nice maltiness that comes through the pleasant bitterness. The malt is perfect. All in all, the best beer I’ve ever had the pleasure to taste.

Bottled 32cl. It pours a yellow beer with a quick diminishing head. The aroma is sour, malty and oily; quite buttery. Slightly metallic. Malty, grainy and oily taste. Skunky, mushroom-like mouthfeel. Quite nicely biscuitty, slightly bready and citrussy. A rather watery lager. A hoppy finish follows. This beer isn’t that bad. It’s very refreshing and drinkable and has a pleasant subtle oiliness.
No aroma, pale golden color and no head. Has a slight honey taste with some grains, but fairly unremarkable. No aftertaste. Good tasting beer, but otherwise it is rather mediocre.

Although opening the bottle produces gushing foam, the beer pours normally, separating into a clear gold liquid and fluffy white head. Alas, the foam lacks stability, and lacing is pitiful. The beer dances with pinprick bubbles. Gentle malt aroma with enticing floral and vanilla notes. Neutral in flavor... barely grassy and sweet, leading to a faint butterscotch finish. A flash of fruity tartness. Unexpected razor-sharp carbonation livens up a soft, thin mouthfeel. Threshold hop spice in the aftertaste. Although rooted in blandness, this beer is far more characterful and far less offensive than US and European macrolagers.

To speak the truth, I had such a spicy food beforehand, I can’t really say much about the flavor. Quite easy, some fresh hoppy bitterness. It may have been the kimchi, but this seemed to develop similar vibes as a cork faulty wine. Fungus?

Pour is a dark golden with a white head.  Aroma has some malt along with corn and a light fruit.  Flavor has a malty note along with a slight bit of hops and a grain like taste.  Not bad tasting just a so-so beer.
I wasnt actually too offended by this. Grainy malts hints of maise and some grassy hop character, however still not one to rave about.

Aroma of herbal hops, grainy. Pale, yellow coloured with a medium white head. Taste is sweet, watery. Some hops and grain, more sugar. Not too good. 

Original rating 1.8. New rating: bit sweet, too much ugly grain in taste.
no much flavor, a bit too much fizz. A big disappointment will not get again. also over priced

Overall, a pretty mediocre beer. Urine sample look with a lame fizzy white head.  There are so many variations of this beer.  Adjunct nose and taste with a nonexisting finish.  Just plain boring.  Not the worst ever, but far far FAR from high quality.

Clear golden yellow coloured with some light carbonation and a small white head. Sweet, sugary hoppy aroma. Medium, sweet palate. Finish is sweet, malty grainy touches and very light bitter. Overall much to sweet.
Light gold, with a thick white head.  Not much aroma, mostly pale malt.  Medium/light body, with a bit of tang, perhaps a bit aged.  Overall, not too bad.
Basic brew. Once again, nothing special to note, unimpressed.  Probably all they drink in Manila...

Bottled from Trader Joe’s.  Sickly yellow with medium white head.  Very light smell of corn and hops.  Tastes about the same, with a little sweetness and a hoppish bite.  Not much here at all, though, and it’s only slightly better than most light beers.

12oz bottle.  aromas of fresf cut grass and garden greenery; hints of thyme and faint herbs.  pours a golden straw color with a fairly adequate foamy head. tastes smooth for the style, but overall, that fresh grass comes back grainy in the taste and i feel like i’m now eating grass, like the victim of a bully.  good for an everyday-after-work kinda thing, but still not for me.

Canned: Pours a very pale yellow with a thin white head. Damp cardboard aroma with a light hint of apple juice sweetness. Slightly sweet flavor with a light doughy character, some watery apple juice hints and a very light papery finish. Extremely thin and bland, but not too repulsive.
Bottle.  Pale golden colour with short head. Weak aroma of grains. Flavour is grainy with some hoppiness. An ok tasting normal straw lager. Present mailed from the UK.

12 oz bottle from a Beers of the World sampler, thanks to my sweet wife..  Bottle label says 5% abv.  This is a beer I remember drinking as a young junior officer while on a navy deployment in the Pacific.  Same as it ever was.  Not very good then or now.   But it is drinkable.   Has a dirty smell, and a fairly strong lager flavor for such a fizzy beer.   At least it is/was consistent, reliable, and available almost everywhere in the Pacific Rim.  Too many of the other beers were pure headache in a bottle.
identical appearance to Tiger Beer. no aroma. taste is a bit malty. not the worst beer ever.

Bottled.  A light gold/orange coloured beer with athin off-white head.  The aroma is a little buttery and grassy with some corn thing going on.  The taste is fairly clean and crisp. Inoffensive without any Earth shattering malts or hops; but it’s drinkable and there is a certain citricity which sets it apart from some others.

This beer has a very healthy head that did leave a good amount of lacing. The aroma is also very pleasing. The taste is nice and refreshing, and has a very nice balanced bitterness to it. If this was on special (like less than 6-7 bucks) at the store and it was hot outside, then this will do just fine!

Looks like Schweppes made this one, as it had an amazing amount of big CO2 bubbles fizzing their way to the top of the glass through the clear piss-yellow liquid - not very appealing. Smells of skunk and corn, with a touch of metal. On tasting there is a burst of adjuncty alcohol, with some bready malt. Flavour is predictably sweet, but not cloying. Some bitterness in the aftertaste as the sweetness subsides. Medium bodied, which is a bit of a surprise, and reasonably chewy, but both those are only good qualities when it’s pleasant tasting, which this isn’t particularly so. Not the worst pale lager out there, but it would be an offence to drink this again.

The 12 ounce bottle poured a crystal clear light golden colored beverage with a small fizzy head that was almost entirely gone in 60 seconds and left little to no noticeable lacing on the glass. The aromas were primarily of roasted malt, bread and toast.  The body was medium-light with lively carbonation and a watery texture. The flavor started off almost neutral, not sweet nor bitter nor sour. It was like a mouth full of bread. The finish was very short but the beer did take on a nice bitterness toward the end.

Bottle, from a Chinese supermarket, Leicester.  Pale gold with a white foam.  Aromas are sour lemon with dry biscuit and caramel malts.  Flavours are dry cardboard with hints of caramel.  Some acidicy with soap on the finish.  Not great.

Drank this swill while in the Marines while stationed in Okinawa.  Had one recently for nostalgic reasons.  Cant believe I used to drink this stuff.  Typical cheap pale lager.  No subtlety, character, nor taste.
Little aroma or flavor. Medium gold color. Slightly more body than BMC lagers. In a World Market variety pack.

From bottle.  Pours a soft yellow-brown.  Hops easy to smell.  First sip is awfully drab, which I suppose makes it easy to guzzle.  Malts and hops really come out with the finish.  Certainly not a bold flavor.    Not bad.
Can: A bright golden bubbly brew. A stingy bitterness as you get passed half of it; straight forward lager.
Bottle, painted label. Golden color. Soft grainy aroma with a hint of dust. Grainy flavor with apple, hardly any hopbitterness. Short aftertaste. Typical overseas pale lager.

Bottle. Poured clear amber with a large frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate sweet malty and citrus aroma. Light to medium body with soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of short duration.
Yellow golden hue with a fizzy white head.  Grainy, wet malt aromas lead to a thin,  sweet corn flavor. Light-bodied with faint flavors of sour hops. Not good.
Awful beer.  Sickening urine aroma.  Pour is clean, clear, transparent pale gold.  Taste is not as bad as the aroma, with the slightest bit of hops.  Watery.  Good thing I only paid $5 for the six.
Very poor beverage.  Tastes like a regular Budweiser and that’s it.  Don’t waste time or money on this unless you are in the Phillippines.
Pours light golden and unclear with a thin, maintained white head. Aroma of corn, and herbal grassiness. Taste is similar, not impressive. Mouthfeel is light bodied, with lively carbonation.

Light golden color,small white head that faded quickly leaving nothing behind.The aroma was light malt some hints of corn and a faint appearance of hops,very faint.The flavor was uneventful with a bit less malt and more corn then i was expecting,some faint,faint hints of fruit possibly some citrus with a bitter sweet side coming on as it warms up a bit.Definately not there best,but since it was free i won’t complain any more then this.
Earlier Rating: 8/20/2006 Total Score: 1.8
Light golden color,small white head that fades quickly leaving nothing behind.The aroma was mildly malty with some hints at some corn possibly and some cheap shots at hops.The flavor was pretty weak,mild malt something that sorta came off to me as medicinal and some metallic hops in the end with a faint bitterness.No question it goes down fairly easy but for flavor it just doesn’t have it,but for free i’m not complaining to much.

A friend of mine (not a real beer drinker) first had this when oversees, and swore by it. Since I wanted to rate a beer from the Phillipines, I gave it a go. Not much here above your typical BMC. Poured to yuour typical BMC look, and  smelled and tasted like Amelda Marcos’s shoes. I drank this down to say I did, but I would actually prefer just having a BMC to drinking this again.

Bottle from Pat’s.  Pale gold pour with minimal fizzy head.  Slight aroma and flavor of hopcitrus, slight honey.  Watery palate.  Not the worst pale lager I’ve had by a long shot, but not one I’d drink again either.

A friend of mine gave me the rare opportunity to try a southeast Asian beer. She brought back a 330 mL can of San Miguel Pale Pilsen for me to try.

The San Miguel brewery has been around since 1890 and was once considered a world-class brewing operation. Now, however, it seems to have floundered in trying to settle for the bottom line. It’s easily the largest brewery in the Phillipines and is said to have a 90+% market share in many southeast Asian countries. It also brews two truly abominable brews under liscense: Miller Genuine Draft and Löwenbräu.

To say that I had high expectations for this particular macro would be a lie. Nevertheless, I thought I’d give it a chance.

Pleasant aromas filled the room the moment I cracked open the seemingly quaint 330 mL narrow-mouth can. Upon further investigation, the first aroma I picked up was decidedly metallic. I associated the aroma with brass. Beneath the metal, there was a generic citrus aroma that stymied all of my efforts to provide a more exact description. As the beer warmed up, a pleasant hint of mushroom started showing up.

As I poured the beer into a glass, a large head was raised. It dissipated almost completely within three minutes of pouring. The color was very pale, lighter than Mountain Dew when held up to a nearby lamp. Plenty of carbonation graced the beer, although it seemed to express itself with unusually large bubbles instead of a melange of smaller ones.

The flavor seemed light for a beer of 5% strength, and lacked a lot of qualities that I expect and enjoy in this style. Make no mistake about it: this beer is brewed in the international pils style, not the Czech-German pils tradition.

There’s a light malty pils flavor that seems to run the gamut of the tongue and then stop on a time. I was impressed by this finesse and control. Many smashmouth brews have macho flavor experiences that could only dream of exacting such a precise blow.

On the other hand, the pils style ought to be well hoped. It should have a crisp flavor brought on by the bitterness of hops and elaborated by perfuming hops. This beer, however, has no detectable hopping. It pretty much only plays its generic malt flavor, except for the occasional hint of mushroom or cranberry as the beer warms. The aftertaste is really where the good flavors are. There’s a complex malty aftertaste that makes you want to sip it, which is difficult given the beer’s quaffability.

If the ingredients list is to be trusted, this beer might actually have been brewed in the Reinheitsgebot tradition. It lists only malt, cereals, and hops. Upon examing their website, however, I doubt that the beer meets that standard of purity. Practically all brewers that adhere to the Reinheitsgebot boast about it online. That San Miguel makes no mention of the issue is evidence enough for me.

For all of its faults, this beer is extremely well balanced. The taste and the aftertaste are like sitting on a swing on a nice summer day. The direct malty flavor is elaborated upon by the complex malty aftertaste.

A nice aroma.  Nice bitter initial taste which moves into a smooth sweetness.  Some good herbal qualities and a solid carbonation factor.  Unfortunately, it is a bit watery and there is a mild aftertaste ... maybe a freshness issue.  No expiration date!  This isn’t bad.  Other import beers with better pedigrees are much maltier and icky-sweeter.  This doesn’t try to mask its hoppiness.  Pretty refreshing.  Definitely worth the $1/bottle price.
Standard lager thats a little bit thin and watery. Ive had better and ive had worse.

Back in my Navy days, I would go ashore in Spain quite frequently and the best beer available was San Miguel, a local product. Picked up this single for nostalgia but this is NOT the same beer. Anyways...

Pours a crystal clear pale gold with a thin snow white head. Some light lacing. Smells strongly of sweet corny malt.

Taste is also of sickly sweet corn malt. Some faint hops. Malt turns sour as it warms. Ulck... Mouth is lightly sticky, not even any lager crispness and so watery and thin. Brutal to get through. Easily the worst beer I’ve reviewed. My first all 1’s.

Someday I hope to try the Spanish version again to erase the memory of this dreck.
a light golden colour with a very thin head. has a sorta  smooth clean hoppy taste and a very faint smell.

330 mL bottle:  I’ve always enjoyed this brew but never been able to figure it out.  This is a much more golden colour than most pale lagers (although it calls itself a premium lager).  Typical of the style, it has a sweet taste with fuzzy malt and faint hops in there.  Very clean but not as clean a finish as you would expect - almost a little sour.  Very sweet upfront to get you started.  This is a pale lager going for something extra and not sure it works.  Don’t pass it up though, good hot weather beer! Way more interesting than most "lighter" beers.
Clear yellow gold colour with thin white head. Grainy malt nose. Sweet grainy malt taste with little to no finish at all.

Golden yellow, grainy sweet aroma, but no stinky corn in my sample. Clean palate, some faint hop character, with a dry finish. I had this before an Old Miluakee and it was by far the better beer between the two, but I guess that isn’t saying much!
Earlier Rating: 6/19/2005 Total Score: 2.1
Standard pale lager. Refreshing but unexciting. Similar to North American pale lagers, but with less sweetness. Typical of most beers with mass appeal.

Soft easy going style. Very much in the mainstream mould in terms of appearance and taste. Corn syrup like malts drive most of the palate. Drier flavours than what I remember but not what I would call good ’dry’ (ie bad Asahi dry). Structurally quite sound but boring. Miles better than other examples and interestingly previous tastings were from bottle (this was canned).
12 oz. bottle.  Not much on the aroma.  Some corny malt.  Flavors weren’t much better.  Watery and plain.  Oh well....

Can delivered to me from the Phillipines (thanks Curtis!).  Pale is accurate ... straw colored with a sticky, gluey white head.  Corny aroma and equally starchy flavors ... ricey and crisp.  In a blind taste, I might have labeled this High Life or something.
Earlier Rating: 1/3/2003 Total Score: 2.3
Nothing to get excited about, but nothing super disgusting about it either.  Standard large brewery stuff ... light in color, small head, mere light grain/malt flavors.
Robe blonde pâle transparente surmontée d’une mousse blanche mince qui persiste. Sans arôme. Saveurs légères de céréales sucrée et de houblon amérisant.

The aroma is hard to detect but it does have some corn like malt and a smidgen of alcohol. The appearance is pale gold with a small head. The flavor is a lot like San Mig Light except a little stronger. The palate is thin but ok for a lager. The aftertaste is sour. I am not all that impressed with this beer but I wasn’t expecting much.
Poured from the bottle, medium sized head. Taste was watery, nothing special. A good, light(er) beer in the summertime.
Bottle.  Yeast, with some hops.  Nothing special at all, and tastes pretty much just like a regular, typical beer that I’ve had.  Oh well.

an average beer that will leave little memory; quite quenchable, however, if hungry and thirsty, and that’s what condition i was in; but when you’re okay and you want a beer? there’s nothing much, cut any more and you got an ultra... overall: quick and like nothing when thirsty; otherwise, it’s light, watery, a lager from the east...

the aroma was yeasty.Decent head.Color typical straw.Taste was somewhat biting.Hops.There was a hint of cherries at the finish,and hops.Easy to drink.Doesn’t insult the taste buds,but I would look for something better.
Fairly average lager although I’d imagine it would go down quite nicely in the heat of the Philippines. Standard taste. Refreshing and decent, although not great.

Not a bad mid-end lager for lawnmowing or volleyball. Very strong malt flavor that was fairly sweet. Clearly not a fruit beer, but it seemed to have a small touch of cherries in the finish that was somewhat balanced with some hops. Would drink this one again.

Pours light golden yellow with a thin white head that dissappeared quickly and light carbonation. I’m still waiting for the flavour to kick in, but I’m not holding my breath. I would have to say there is nothing to hate about this beer, but there is also nothing to like..... I’m still waiting for the flavour....

330ml Bottle: Pours insanely light, almost clear, with a dissipating head and very light carbonation.  Unpleasant aroma of Lord-knows-what, I don’t want to smell it again to try and figure it out.  Flavour is a hit of bitter, pales quickly to nothingness.  The Coors Light/Corona kids of the world will wet themselves over this.  I’ve had much worse, but there’s much better to be had too.  The stubby is pretty.

Ugh. Swill, swill, swill. It don’t matter if it comes from Wisconsin, France, Russia or Phillipines. Swill is swill and this is swill. I can’t believe I thought this might be anything different. Nothing enjoyable about this, and it’s best to be consumed ice cold.
