Piss yellow with fizzy dying head. Smells like crap. Taste worser than budweiser but still better than lot of other lagers ive had. cool chubby necked bottle

Came in a little squat bottle.  Better than most Latin American pale ales, simply because of the higher alcohol content I suspect (nearly 5% vs. ~3%). But, at over 1 dollar per bottle at the specialty store here in Panama there are much better offerings.
Didn’t much care for this one.  Tasted a bit dry and grainy, a little hops, and a kind of watery.  Nothing much here...

Stubby bottle of six pack.  The initial appearance was light gold and crystal clear. Light carbonation, medium sized white head that diminished quickly and left little lacing. The aroma was pleasantly sweet malty, caramel to corn aroma. The palate was medium to light very slightly creamy with soft carbonation. The initial taste was slightly bitter with a nice malty taste.  The finish was average and slightly bitter.  This is a good lager beer with pleasant, well rounded taste.  Good with party food or after moving the lawn.  I let it warm up a little after taking it out of the fridge.

Allright, but not a pale lager that I would recommend for anybody in any aspect. Nonetheless, it is very pleasant on draft a nice summer day, and in discotecs it is good because of its light flavour and aroma, but it does not fit well into the concept "enjoy".
What can you say?  It’s not awful, certainly better than our American Macros, but just a pretty average South Asian / Pacific Islander beer, comparable to an above average Mexican beer.

First six-pack ever, bottles, yesterday.
Always markets itself (or its my perception) as Mexican elite.
I saw "lager" and bought it. I was diasppointed. 
When it sat in my mouth it had a grainy and chemical taste with a not pleasant lingering. Didn’t think it had a clean taste. Too much corn? Hard to tell.
I want to say average but I can’t even say that. Far from the worst I’ve had, though.

330ml Stubby Bottle, 5% a/v
Pours gold with a dense white head. Smells like corn and a bit of alcohol. Tastes of corn and some sweetness with a watery and hoppy finish. Not bad really.

12oz bottle pours pale golden with a light fluffy white head that didn’t stay long.  Aroma is skunk, corn, and a touch of grain.  Flavor is much the same.  A lot of corn and a bit of grain.  Just a touch of hops on the finish.  This wasn’t very good but well I must say I wasn’t expecting a whole lot.

Got a 6-pack at Binny’s at Highland Park, IL. No particles floating, nor was there dust in the bottle (A good sign, considering this is an imported beer). I coulld not detect a skunky scent when I opened it (another good sign). Slight acidic taste at first, but has a clean finish and aftertaste. Best drunk ice-cold on a summer day!
Pale yellow colour with a minor moslly diminishing head. Not much aroma, nor much flavour. Watery body.
Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly deminihing head. Pale yellow colour. Nice average aroma and flavor. A little watery, but a deasent pale lager.

Bottled

Pale yellow color, decent white head. Skunky hoppy aroma. Light bodied, some faint barnyardish hoppy flavor. Really awful and this even wasn’t very old bottle.
pours yellow with a small white compact head. Aromas of grain, malts, blah. Flavor is malty, watered down, grainy-cornlike, with a slighty bitter hoppy finish. This beer is like most most US macros.
Had this at a friend’s birthday, and went down ok. Maybe it was the less intense flavour that kinda made me put it down after the first one. But its ok.

NOt really bad, I expected less from this brewery but it gave me the rusprise of not being as the one in Spain, almost when I was going to argue about having two different here, i guess it should be done the same with Corona.

From a distinctive San Miguel stubby brown bottle with a blurb about the lager on the back label. Made a good appearance, poured a clear pale lager 
golden with a nice foamy white that reduced to a fine bubbly lacing. Had a clean aroma, only a faint graininess and hops. Moderate carbonation and a smooth, dry light medium bodied mouth feel, good drinkability. Has your macro lager taste, a light sweet maltiness and graininess with a soft hop bite, and a dry grainy finish.

Poured a sunny yellow with a bubbly head.  Plain blonde malt aroma with no hops to speak of.  Fairly nondescript flavour but oh, wait, after a few sips there’s some vegetable notes kickin around.  Drinkable but not memorable in the least.

Bottle says 5%. Clear yellow/gold. Lots of bubbles form a small, dense, creamy, white head. Almost no aroma. Subtle corn, malt, and alcohol. Perhaps a slight tinge of urine, also. The dark lager is not bad, atleast it’s drinkable. This is Phillipine budweiser. Grainy corn and malt flavor along with some bitterness coming from a vomit-urine combo rather than hops. Only the finish and aftertaste have a touch of the smooth, slightly roasty, sweetness one finds in a well made pale lager. Completely void of the crisp, clean hops found in such a brew. Light, balanced body. Drain pour.
Bottle.  Slightly sweet malt aroma.  Golden yellow with small head.  Weird syrupy sweetness with high acidity and moderate carbonation.  Aroma was promising but flavor let me down.

Just sampled, I must say San Miguel has lost a great deal of taste over the years. Perhaps the recipe has changed since I used to enjoy it. Lost is the full bodied crisp and dry brew that was a premium thirst quencher. Today it is just a corn coloured light, stick your tongue out the window flavoured thin beer of no great quality.

(Bottle 33 cl) Slightly hazy pilsener golden with a small, white head. Vague aroma of malt and...chlorine? Body is thin with some weak,  malty notes and only a hint of hops in the finish. Poor. 080106

Bottle from the LCBO in Toronto.  Bright golden colour, lasting white coloured head, some lace, lively carbonation.  The aroma was slightly metallic, some floral hops, grains, and some sweetness.  The flavour was floral and sweet, grassy, clean and crisp.  Bitter mouthfeel, light body, medium/high carbonation.  Finishes with a lingering bitterness, dry.  Better then expected.
Pours a nice golden yellow.  Aromas of malts, hops.  Crisp hop bitterness and dry finish.
640ml bottle-pours a foamy white head that becomes minimal.  Yellow color with effervescence.  Aroma is grain.  Taste is grain, good carbonation.  Nice.  Bottled 10/05.

Nice packaging for this lager.
In appearance it resembles every other "macro" lager out there. Plain corn yellow with a small bubble white head.
Aroma is almost nonexistent , what there is smellsor very weak hops and a Busch like adjunt ,chemical like smell.
Taste is very weak also , reminds me a lot of Budweiser, weak, semi-sweet and with a weird astringency at the end.
Thin over carbonated mouthfeel.
Not very drinkable, quite a bore.
Ive had three Asian lager recently this is the poorest. If I had to choose between ,say, Tiger and this Tiger is much better.
Oh, hell no. This is pure welfare lager. Has that gross stale vegetably smell you would expect from third-world beers, and that watery, gassy body to match. This sucks.

Overall much better than I expected.  Had a slight skunky smell which disappated in a cold glass.  Worth the trouble but I’ts not as good as most Mexican beers.  For a Philipino beer it is worth a try.
bottle. Nothing special here just an average lager. pours a clear light golden colour. Very little head or lacing. There is very little there, it is too watered down.
Bottled, in Hong Kong. Fairly average lager. Fizzy, non-descript but doable when faced with some of the other options.

Anyone not enjoying this beer needs to be set on an island in the south pacific and starved of beer.  Wave one of these beauties in front of them then give it to me so I can drink it!

The stuff from a bottle with a  paper label is a cheap imitation of the beer from a painted bottle...

Pours a clear golden with a medium white head which fades quickly. Aroma of grain and grass. Flavor is sweet with notes of grain, corn, grass, hay and hop bitterness presence at the end. Medium body, smooth texture and lively carbonation. Drinkable, I’ve had a lot worse.
drain pour,even worse than  the original. Not much to say more .. I hoped the sink enjoyed this

drinkable in quanity with a very weak aftertaste. great for necking. Overall flavour is weak,  but finer carbonation is noticed which produces an average head for a beer of its type. not many that i have come across wondering what the second one will taste like but in my opinon definately worth the gamble. most certainly over a calsberg anyway...

Bottled.
Clear yellow coloured  with a small white head.
Aroma of malts and corn with hoppy notes.
Malty flavour with notes of caramel and corn and a hoppy finish.
An OK pale lager, but still it’s nothing special.

Typical light yellow appearance, clear.  Smells like a little bit of nail polish or acetone in the corn and fuesal aroma.  Taste is light and fizzy, prickly with a tinge of metal and hay.  Simple, a bit lightstruck, and overall very sour.
Typical golden lager look. Nice malt aroma with some floral hops. Decent body and good carbonation with a crisp finish. Some bitterness.  Lacking in flavor. Good lacing. Clean.

Bottle (330 ml).  Poured pale gold, diminishing white head.  Smell is sour-sweet like a sweet white wine going to vinegar, some grains, a touch raisiny.  Taste is like apple juice from concentrate!  There’s no hops, no malt, no alcohol - just cheap tetra-pack apple juice with a hint of vanilla.  Fizzy watery slightly sticky mouthfeel.  Not vile, but not beer, either.  A little harsh on warming, too.
Clear yellow color,whit light head.No aroma and no flavor from this beer.IS watery all the way....
Light hoppy nose, along with some malts. Yellow body, small white head. Weak and watery flavor, ends on a very small hop note.
The beer with no taste! Bland to the extreme. Thank god the word beer appears on the bottle ’cause you would not believe it. Skip this one, unless it’s so hot outside, you’d drink anything.

The flagship beer from San Miguel. The only beer that has made me wish for a Budweiser. Real bad sour urine smell hits your nose upon opening. Thin pallet gets aggressively sweet in a sickly fashion. The finish will make you reach for a Colt 45, both the drink and the weapon. Don’t let the quiant stout little bottle fool you, this beer has all the hallmarks of such classic bad beers as Natural Ice, and O’Keefs extra Old Stock. Avoid.

I would like to add an update 3 years later, this beer will grow on you if you have no other alternatives. Still ice cold though. And with salty spicy stuff to eat. I am holding the rating at .9 for real beer drinkers, and upping it to 1.5 for the poor bastards stuck on this rock.
A nice golden beer with a frothy head.aromas of malt and some sweetness.The malt followed thru to the flavor  as this had some crispness.I didnt think this was as bad as the others thought.
Bottle. Golden color with a white head. The taste is a thin malty body with a light and watery palate. Light bitter notes in the finish.
Standard Pale nothing is great about it and once u get used to the taste is a very enjoyable drink

Very reminicent of commercial American pale lager.  There are other local beers available but they are all sub-standard.  San Miguel really isn’t all that bad once you get used to it.  There is a good head on it when you poor and effervescence in the glass.  There are other various renditions like SMB Light, SMB Super Dry {is actually is] and SMB Strong Ice.  All are very similar.  If you are here, in the Philippines, and want to sample the local brew, SMB is really your only choice.

Couleur dorée, très faible mousse blanche nous quittant aussitôt, peu de dégagement gazeux lors du service.  Arômes muets rappelant quelques douces épices variées.  Absolument horrible en bouche, se résumant pas mal à cire à crayon à colorier et plastique brûlé. Très mince, aqueuse, tentative de houblons floraux en finale.  Les bières industrielles d’ici sont nettement supérieures par leur transparence.

From the stubby poured clear golden. 
Nothing special. Mossy smell. Flavour was malty sweet start, bitter middle. light finish with no lingering aftertaste. 
re rated (I had it rated higher than some beers on my list I knew were better)  and had to say, again...nothing special.

Light Yellow-Gold clear beer with a fairly long lasting white thin head which is easily regenerated. Long lacing. Nice aroma with soft malt and good hop notes. Average malt flavour with some nice but subtle hop flavours. Relatively light bodied with some residual sweetness. Mild bitterness and a clean finish.

Flavourless pale lager from the Phillipines. Poured a very pale gold but with a healthy head that hung around for a bit and left some lace. Sweet inoffensive aroma of fresh bread-like malt if you’re feeling generous, cardboard and corn if you’re not. First sip is pretty awful - corn, wet cardboard, a hint of sulphur, lemonade. Body is fizzy and soda-like. It gets better once you get past that first taste but only because it swiftly ceases to taste of anything much at all. No finish to speak of. Designed not to offend.
Huge white head. Quite watery and thin. Creamy mouthfeeling. Sweet in a artificial way. Not something you wan’t to drink outside the Philippines.
I really enjoyed this one, it was reccommended to me by a friend, great taste, smooth, and overall great

My wife and I had our first ever San Miguels in January 2004 sitting on the promenade next to the Aberdeen fishing market in Hong Kong. It’s pretty popular there.
The stubby brown bottles poured a clear yellow with a bright white head. Decent carbonation. The taste was light, mild, a bit sweet with a hint of hops. Rather thin-tasting, I’d call it crisp and thirst-quenching. Definitely very drinkable, but a beer you want to drink with a spicy meal, rather than on its own.
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a medium white head. Weak corny light lemon aroma and a sweet thin light lemon taste. Watery body and a sweet finish.
Pale golden colour with a small white head. Malty sweet aroma with cereal notes. Malty sweet flavor with a light fruityness.
Bottled. Pale golden coloured. Very thin and watery. Almost no aroma. Almost no flavour.

sweet corny aroma with with a slightly bitter smell.  Clear golden beer with high white head which is gone in a flash.  Huge bubbles.  Very corny flavour, no hops, would be better with lime or lemon. finish is very smooth, slightly metalic and bitter.  different, but not exceptional

Tasted in Bali on my honeymoon, I really wish I hadn’t bothered, as it was like downing a glass of lemonade. Pours a clear pale gold, with large bubbles failing to form any head (or anything at all). Slightly astringent ’grape skin’ aroma, with a little citrus and sugar. Quite dry in the mouth and slightly sour, almost like a glass of chardonnay. Very thin bodied, quite spritzy in carbonation and finishes with a short, crisp forgettable swallow. I just hope I had a bad sample, as I couldn’t even see this as a thirst quencher. Awful!!!
Standard golden lager appearance, fair head, some lacing. aroma is sweet honeyish with some grassy hops. cloying sweetness, no real flavour, light hop bitterness.

Bottel bought in Indonisia by my friend Derek.
Pale golden, some bitterness. Not interesting but ok for a warm sunny day.
I dreaded drinking this... but I was sort of pleasantly surprised.  A slight sweetness on the initial taste makes this one tolerable.
330ml brown bottle. Poured an extra pale yellow. Decent looking white head. Grassy hop aroma, sweet malts. Decent level of malt, trace hops.

Medium-gold. The aromas and flavours are closely aligned: very sugary-sweet, with a touch of malt and caramel, and very, very little bitterness. Despite the lack of balance, it’s surprisingly refreshing. Odd and intriguing, though not what every little lager should aspire to when it grows up.

Can.  See, my plan for beating jet lag was to figure out when it was 10 pm or so Taiwan time on the plane and pass out, so that I’d be sleeping when I needed to be.  Problem was, I was wide awake at this point, somewhere over the Pacific.  So the really cool Filipina stewardess, who was sympathetic to my problem, agreed to mix Crown and 7 for me and keep bringing them until I passed out.  Did I say I love Filipinas?  I don’t remember how many it took, but before long I was snoozing while on the way to my promised land of Asian babes.  Two points for Chad!  So then I’m in the Cathay Pacific lounge in Hong Kong at 7:00 am local time, and the plan from there was to drink caffeine, plunge through the day, and get a good night’s rest before meeting my future boss for breakfast at 7:30 the next morning.  But, they had this stuff for free in the lounge and I can’t say no to a beer I haven’t rated.  And dude - the can I drank it out of had a freaking pull tab on it!  Like, the ones that you stopped seeing 15 years ago.  I stopped briefly to ponder the strange value that I was placing on obsolete can-opening methods while I regarded the white, foamy head and color that reminds me of when I just start a creatine cycle and don’t drink enough water...you know what I mean if you’ve been there.  Yeah.  The aroma wasn’t as skunky as I was I have come to expect from Asian lagers, but it had a sort of...barnyard smell.  It’s funny that I’m using a word reserved almost exclusively for guezes on San freaking Miguel.  Malts and wet cardboard dominated the taste.  Not completely offensive but I ain’t going out of my way to get it again.  Oh yeah - the can clearly said that it was made in HK and did not mention the Phils at all, it even had Mandarin characters on the side.
Earlier Rating: 9/2/2002 Total Score: 1.3
I actually didn't get a whole lot of skunk out of this.  Ssn Miguel would be my beer of choice to get stranded on a desert island with...because it could keep me hydrated a lot longer than anything else.
Bottle in Philippines. Golden with thin white head, this is the most popolar beer in the Philipppines. When cold  not bad in hot weather. Nothing outstanding pretty standard Asian lager.
Bottle.  Nose is standard lager malt mixed with corn adjunct.  Sweet flavor with an interesting lemony flavor in the end, trending towards wheat germ as it warms.  Drinkable premium lager.

A little too much bubbly here and not enough flavor at all. I’ve had seltzer water with more flavor than this.  It is quite easy to drink, and does have the slightest bitterness in afterthought.  Boring.

Practically nonexistent foam. Limpid yellow color moved enough. Difficult to perceive scent or aroma. A lot fizzy and bitter. Nearly sufficient but unfortunately it is excessive watery and little long-lasting.
Clear yellow, frothy fading head. Faint stale corny aroma. Stale, slightly hoppy paper taste. Could be worse.

Mild, sweet, clean and inoffensive in both aroma and flavour.  Clear, golden coloured with decent white head that recedes to lasting cover.  Light body is somewhat watery but has nice engaging carbonation without being overly gassy.  Bottle.
Dark gold colour. Aroma is unclean - fruity, phenolic (medicinal). Body is light, flavour watery. But still it’s phenolic. Mercifully quick finish.

Bottle pored yellow with no head a bit of malt in the aroma with a plain grassy flavor .
Ok on a hot day when you want to drink a lot of beer ...but then so is keystone.. but not bad at all.

When fresh this is an excellent beer.  However, in the Philippines this beer is normally stored improperly.  Due to that, the flavor and aroma are drastically affected.  The export version and the local version are totally different.  My rating applies only to the bottled local beer sold in the Philippines.
Pours a pale yellow with a smallish white head. Aromas of......uh......ummm...o.k. so not so much in the aroma department. Tastes of bubbles, water,......kinda beerish I guess. Not a top ten’er.

Colour was good and the head wasn’t bad with some touches of lacing also. Initial skunky aroma which disappeared quickly to a faint grainy aroma. Taste was fairly bland and uninspiring, a little metallic, light malt and not enough bite for me.
Poured a light yellow with a smaller white head. Not much to the aroma and taste. Kinda of skunky. Little sweet flavor. Pass…

Nice golden body topped with a thin bubbly head. Average malty aroma with various hints of herbs, hops and biscuit. Without being impressive, taste is well-balanced. Mouthfeel ends with a short hoppy finish. I was expecting another tasteless asian lager, but this one was very drinkable.

Medium golden color with a well retained egg white head. Aroma is underwhelming with a bit of spicy hoppiness.  Flavor really surpasses the aroma by having a pleasent malty biscuit flavor to compliment the spicy hoppiness.  This is imported by a local company and I think we get very fresh samples.  I enjoyed all six of the six pack.

Pale golden wth thick, fluffy white head.  Light citrus aroma, a bit of spice.  Flavour is very clean, light malt.  Finish has a touch of paper/cardboard.  No bitterness/hops at all.  Pretty standard.
Bottle. Pale Yellow pour.  Skunky aroma, almost sour wine like. Syrupy corn taste. Thank you LCBO discount bin.  And thanks to Jercraigs for helping me get through this.

Bottle. Crisp pale yellow with a smallish film of a head. Grainy slightly grassy hop notes in the aroma with a mildly skunky undercurrent. Tiny bit of bitterness can’t help this thin boring beer. Thanks for sharing Tupalev, hopefully the homebrew turns out better than this did!
Definitely brewed in the style of American mass-market pale lagers (with crack corn and rice) but with slightly better malt flavor.  Okay to drink on a hot, humid day.

Guam SwillFest 2004: Pours light yellow with a thin white head. Slightly skunky aroma with hints of coffee and light hops. Streaming carbonation. Light fruit flavor-apple and grape. Finishes slightly bitter with more coffee taste.

Medium yellow, fizzy head slowly fades off totally.  Aroma is of corn and a cobweb dusty note.  Malt profile is corn dominated, reminiscent of the High Life.  There is a smattering of bittering hops on the finish.  Not a fantastic beer by any means, but a leg up on most international lagers.

Pours golden in color. Smells a little malty. Tastes like watered down corn. Pretty sweet too. Not a whole lot to say about this beer. I like the sweetness, which separates it from US macros, but still not much here.
Light gold in colour with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet and slightly hoppy. Taste is sweet, with a mild bitterness. Ordinary beer.
Nasty stuff... golden in colour with little aroma. Lots of canned corn flavor, along with a disgusting sweetness. Yuck! This is one to avoid!
Not too bad, but not too great either.  A drinkable Asian lager better than many of the THai lagers.  A little too weak flavoured though.

Brought back by a friend from the Philippines along with 3 others from the "area". Pours yellow with a medium fizzy white head. Aroma is slightly sweetened corn syrup with a splash of hay. Taste is very BMC like to me. Sort of crisp but a very average pale lager, really. Definitely not a pilsener at all. Body is slightly overcarbonated and is thin. However, it is sort of refreshing and not too bad tasting. Finish is sweet with a hint of metal. This is even canned. That does not bode well considering the others he brought back were canned. Ugh.
Earlier Rating: 5/17/2004 Total Score: 1.4
This also pours yellow with a tall white head. This head seems foamier that the Light version. Aroma is corn, skunky hops and cardboard. Taste is much like the Light version only sweeter and thicker. Typical corn syrupy taste. Finish is sweet also. Again, this isn't bad especially cold on a warm day, it’s just not recommended when they are other cheaper equally as bad beers to buy.
Bottle. Straw body capped with a thick foamy 3 finger head. Nose is soft and malty. Flavors that come out are vinegar, straw, and water. Very mild. Not bad, but probably would be better with food.
Classic golden color with a decent white head. Fizzy and grassy, decent pale lager taste. Nothing special.

Grassy, malt aroma, pale yellow, pours a large white head, some nice lace too. Corn, adjuncts taste, light bodied, tiny bitterness, ordinary.
Earlier Rating: 4/9/2002 Total Score: 2
Hoppy smell,light golden. Bitter but just. Grassy after taste. May be better ice cold?
Gold colour with a moderate fluffy white head. Sweet, grassy aroma. Flavour of sweet malt and a hint of canned corn. Negligible hop profile. Another average international lager.

Very large, foamy white head. The body is very light gold with lots of bubbles. The aroma is thin. Hints of urine and a little must. The taste is like flour with a little bit of lime. This is another lame lager.
Light golden in color. Super fizzy. Nothing in the aroma department. Flavor of wheat is evident. Light mouthfeel and otherwise pretty weak body. Benign lager.

This is a beer that will have your kidney quizzing: "what the hell was that that went through there so fast?" Light straw color, head fades quickly. Slight citrus smell very little taste. I was able to detect some grains and slight hopping, sweet finish. Not really a beer I would classify as a “Pilsen”. Not even a lame attempt at one……sweet finish????? They must love corn and rice so much in the Phillipines that they like it in beer to....even though it doesn’t belong there
Skunky aroma. Pale straw color with white head. Tastes like a cheap domestic lager.

Pretty typical adjuncty pale lager.  Corny, not unattractive pale golden color.  Light unbalanced flavor on the sweet side with hardly any hops.  If not ice cold it warms into a thickish corny sweet mess.

Bottle: Poured gold with a beautiful head that lasted and laced very well. Not much aroma... some sweet malt, some hops. Watery malt flavour with noticable hop (POR??). Body was similar. Generally watery and witohut much flavour, but nevertheless can be refreshing. Good for a hot, humid day.
Blonde with a malty grassy nose. Rather standard lager taste, slightly better than molbat, but still not uplifting. Bottled.
San Miguel has a very refreshing feel. It also has nice mild taste and it makes you want more. Very good beer.
Ah, yet another cheap-smelling, straw-colored pale lager.  Grassy and cardboardy.  Drinking this is about as exciting as watching a pile of fresh shit attract flies.
Pale gold with nice white head. Mild malt flavors with only a hint of hops. Typical mega-lager.
Grainy and skunky hop aroma. Pale golden color, small white head, few lace. Grainy, skunky hop, light sweet, light bitter, typical asian lager.
malt aromas. golden color with a thin almost nonexistent head. malt flavors mild hops very dry and unexciting. just like a thousand other blond lagers. mindless swill.

Crystal clear pale straw color out of the bottle with a fizzy yellow head that left some lacing.  Strong nose of acetate and corn.  Some malt grainy flavors with a faint lemon citrus note.  I suppose it would be good on a hot day with a spicey sandwich.
Light and yellow with a bubbly head. Standard lager. Very crisp bubbles. Not something I will pick up again.

Yellow gold with small sticky head with a little lacing. The aroma is grainy and malty with some biscuity malts along with some spicy citrusy hops, very toasty. The flavor is balanced, standard; predictable. A little skunky with the corn really jumping out in the tail.
Yellow with a big white head. Sweet with a bready malt aroma and flavor. Finish is a little tangy and dry.

It's been at least five years since I tried a San Miguel.  I used to drink it some in college, but now I wonder why I tried it again.

Pale golden color with a massive head and sharp carbonation in the nose and on the tongue.  Some vegetal/cabbage flavors with light malt notes, not much in the way of hops.

Finish is off--nasty.
bright gold, nice full head, some grass in nose, sweet malty/corny, crisp and dry

Straw color, small white head. Plentiful bead.Light corn nose. Wishy washy and bland. Faint corn taste. Very clean and light
Earlier Rating: 1/14/2003 Total Score: 2.3

Sit in an open air cafe in Manila and this will be better than under 'controlled' circumstances. Like a lot of the beers tasted 'en premise' this is an acceptable beer. Trouple is I then had another one in the air conditioned hotel restaurant and all delight falls away. There is some degree of hop aroma but it is overwhelmed by the light corn and sugar nose. Too much effervescence and not a lot of body. I like the bottle though.
Earlier Rating: 2/1/2004 Total Score: 1.8
Ho boy, more ratings. Thanks to a need to travel I get to taste more beers. No thanks to the fact that this is a typical euro style asian lager that emulates all the bad things that define an unexciting and basic beer. There is too much fizz in this without any real balance of hops and malt and all that other stuff which defines a beer of quality.
eveery country has to have their boring lager.  this one belongs to the philipines.  sweet and grainy lager.  boring.
This is the worst beer I have ever tasted.  Smells sickly, tastes putrid.  I bought a 12 pack, drank half a bottle, and donated the rest to the local SB bum.

Had this from a nice tall boy can I got at Christmas '04. Out of 12 different beers, this was the only one left and I waited till now to try it ( the others were gone within hours/days). Crappy looking. She hails from Hong Kong ( very exotic!!! :| ) Somebody tasted a peanut buttery flavour,? I would have gotten sick right there. Then I cracked it. Medium gold, little head, funny ricey sweet aroma. Some hops, brocolli? Pretty strange. Best Chinese beer I've ever had.

i'm rating this beer so high because of tremendous nostalgia.  believe it or not, this was the best beer we could get in korea years ago when i served in the military there.  many cases of this cheap brew were enjoyed after stressful helicopter night flights.  it looked ok - weak pale color with white thin head.  went down watery smooth, was very refreshing with distinct san miguel aftertaste.  i had one again just for this taste test and probably won't have another unless all my flight buddies get together for a reunion.....

2005-02-12, 3-2-4-3-8=20
Blond color. Smell of plastic and alcohol, with the malt. Very common taste; strong bitterness; probably not bad if tasted in Asia…

2003-12-04, 2-2-3-2-6=15
Blond color. Bad corn aroma. Sweet taste, hay, corn. Watery final. Too poor.
Nice aroma, but taste was actually pretty bland. Something weird in the aftertaste, like rice or corn. Sweet. Don´t like it.
Pale but not real good. A very bitter finish. Not great. Probably won't drink again
Simple beer that is quite refreshing. Some malt and hoppy characteristics, has a grassiness to it, and maybe a bit watery. Very easy to drink and would make a great hot-weather beer.
Really, what am i supposed to say about his beer. It sucks, its the same ole shit.
Clear straw color with a wispy white head. Aromas of husky grain and cereal, hints of grassy hops. Sweeter malts, near unattenuated flavors. Finishs dryer, with a husky grain flavor.
White head, not too impressive, tasted like some kind of fungus, not exactally like yeast or anything. Weak overall, but it just tasted pretty bad. I would never reccomend this to anyone
It certainly is pale and has a minimal but persistant head. Virtually no aroma and is initially completely tasteless. Has a crude bitterness at the end.

Staple brew for me.  Best served from the brown bottle, ice cold. Can't complain.  The fresher the better.  Couple month old bottle, you'd be better off sucking on the bottle cap.  The stuff in the can... that ain't beer.
Bright pale gold. Coarse white head. Corn aroma. Light, sugary body. Harsh, slightly metallic flavour of very light malt, corn, & mineral water.

Had it in Olongapo City. Pale yellow, small white head. Clean light american beer flavor. Nothing bad, but nothing special. Drinkable if ICE COLD. Earlier Rating: 6/21/2002 Total Score: 2 On a hot, humid Subic Bay day, after 30 days at sea off the coast of Viet Nam, San Miguel beer was the second best thing on earth (are you with me Gusler ?). To be honest though, it was the time, the place and atmosphere. Not a world class beer, but drinkable if ICE cold. (This is the original painted lable only available in country, not the export).
Earlier Rating: 6/22/2003 Total Score: 2.4
Pale yellow color, small head. Aroma-light beer. Clean tasting lager. Nothing special, but nothing bad. Drinkable. Serve COLD.

Clear, yellow lager. Medium-sized, fizzy, white head.
The nose is of bisquits with a hint of citrus fruit and alcohol. Some skunk as well. Lightstruck? No, brown bottle. Just shitty water or too much O2, I guess.
The flavor is lemony and lightly malty. Nicely bittered and decently balanced.
Light-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and lively carbonation.  Short, pungent (then dry) finish. Not much to this one. Avoid it!

Pours golden with foamy white head.  Aroma is malty, with slight soapiness and juniper hops.  Flavor is decent, malty, noticible hops and a little bit of wood, somewhat watery as well.  Light body and moderate carbonation.  Fairly standard international lager with a bonus point in overall impression for the college memories it brought back.
Crisp, dry. Pale golden. Just an average lager no interesting characteristics.

Not water, not really beer either.
Very thin with not much of aroma and flavour.

Pours straw colored with a white mostly diminishing head.  Mod lacing.  Aroma has herb hoppy nose and taste is lightly sweat.  I also detct some sweatness in flavor but it is rapidly lost to the wattery body and texture.  I am not impressed.

This one pours a clear, golden yellow color with a small, white head. The head does not linger and the beer emits an aroma of hay, grassy hops, and mild skunkiness. It has a light body with lively carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel. The flavor is very faintly malty up front with some corn sweetness. The finish is crisp and slightly sweet. Fairly bland, but not really bad.
Yellow in color with a small white head. Aroma is light malt with dirty sock notes. Flavor is slighly sweet, not much in the way of hops. Watery.

Color is clear yellow with a white fluffy, cheese soft head with divets as it settled down to a skim on the top. Smell is lightly sweet, has some wet grains, corn I think, and some plastic wrapper. Taste is a little empty, some malt thats very slightly sweet and corn starch and is just watery. Feel is light bodied and watered. Have a glass of water and throw some corn and tall grass in.
Yellow, smells of corn, decent head, slightly sweet with a bitter finish. Nothing really distinguishes this beer from any other lager.
Corn oil-like golden colour. Diminishing frothy white head. Corn and grass aroma. Bland, light, empty, watery, maybe a slight oily corn taste. Boring.
Foul heated plastic aroma. Pours hangover piss yellow, completely flat, head weak. Corn laden taste, unsatisfying flavour. Serve extra cold to kill taste buds.

Bright clear light yellow.  White head.  Lots of carbonization.  Very light aroma uncharacteristic of anything.  A sweet, slightly syrupy lager suitable for drinking in very hot climates.  Indistinguishable from many other lagers of the world.
Clear straw colour with no head.  Very thin and corny tasting beer.  Finish was thin and carboanted.  Not great.

Clear straw in color with a head that fights to stay alive. Watery palate. Tin-like, corny malts are light and difficult to distinguish. Strongly carbonated, relative to the light malts that try to keep up. Has somewhat of a "beery" macro flavor to it, especially in the finish. Drinkable, but boring and bland.

A very nice beer, and perfectly priced when in the phillipines....  When given the choice, always buy the Philipino variety over that brewed in Hong Kong - I'm yet to meet anyone who actually enjoyed the HK version, let alone preferred it to the philipino.
A not so great color and white head start this one.  Aroma matches with a lot lacking.  Flavor tastes a little wierd (and I'm not sure how).  Overall, this one lacks in every way.
sucks big time. hint of hops in aroma. zero flavour. i must taake umbrage at the name of this sodapop
At first  I thought this lager wasn't bad nothing special.  Then the second one I had was very watery and crappy.
Very good beer. Smooth and with a great flavor. No aftertaste and not heavy at all.

Very light with quickly diminishing head.  Weird grain/malt taste that seems like the malt was mixed with rice or corn.  Also a not-so-pleasant skunky taste that gets worse if the beer is allowed to warm even a little bit.
(500ml Can) Pours a small creamy head which fully diminish; clear golden body. Light yeast smell. Moderate sweet flavour with a nice but subtle bitter finish.
very clear and clean..slight leathery aroma..pretty light-bodied...fairly typical lager-style beer. gets a couple extra points for not sucking as much BMC
Nothing special here. Very clear. No flavor. Didn't do anything for me.
Could pass for American Standard.  Smells skunky, look clear, taste average. Psycho drama I wouldn''t drink it cold.
Had this in the Philippines.  It has a nice Formaldahyde odor usually with floaters in the bottle but when mixed with the local Mojo whisky concoction it goes down without triggering the gag reflex.

oh man. this is definitely a interesting brew. very weird smell to it. drinks not to easily either. i did drink this lager cold which i imagine they don''t do in the phillippines. but i couldn''t imagine this beer warm..beware. try at your own risk.
It isn''t that bad, but it isn''t memorable.  At least the bottle will look nice in my collection.

Poured clear yellow with a half inch head that was gone in an instant.  Malts are at times doughy, but mostly full of an adjunct tasting sweetness.  There''s a nice bitter hop in the background that has a real difficult time coming thru until the end.  This would be best while laying by a large swimming pool in July.  Thanks Maria - I didn''t know they made beer in the Phillipines!

Lighter than a fizzy yellow beer and fairly low in character throughout. Slight woodiness in the aroma. Grainy dry flavor and underlying sweetness. Dry aftertaste. Nothing offensive, nothing interesting.

I drank it from a can and on the can it had a picture of the bottle. That made me laugh. I found this beer really watery. And skunky. I would not recomend it. But I wouldn''t avoid it if it were given to me.
Went down easy thas about it...and it had a neat bottle.....................
Slightly doughy-sour aroma - but not skunky. Light - but long lasting white head. Very crisp, clean flavor throughout.  Pleasantly surprised to say the least.
Slightly better than average tasting lager.Kept its mild bitterness and carbonation till the finish.
Not as bitter as Mahou, not as full flavored either. Contrary to popular belief, Not a spanish beer, though I think Spain is its biggest market
Pale Golden color with thick white creamy head.  Slightly sour aroma.  Slightly sweet well-balanced flavor turning sour, bitter and hoppy with a sour finish.
Light, dry, and crisp.  Small hops.  Not too bad of a lager.................

Can picked up at a Park 'N shop in Hong Kong.  Light yellow with a white head and rising bubbles.  Slight yeast aroma, bland cardboard flavor.  Mine was brewed at the San Miguel Hong Kong Brewery.  Interestingly, they carried both the HK and Phillipines versions with different labels.
Not a good flavor.  Aroma is like a sweaty constuction worker who has been working through the 4th of July in Mexico, or in this case the Phillipines.  Must bee really cold to enjoy.
Weak hops and lemon...Sweet fruit...And I'm using a microscope..............
Tastes like it's been sitting out in the sun on my roof top all summer long.  I got it out of the fridge section and it was stored in a light tight case though.
Very pale color. Head was soapy and persistent. Mild skunk nose. Decent hops profile. Nice body- ooh la la. Really not terrible for an oriental lager- is that a great compliment or what?
Brothy and metallic. Malty, brothy smell. Decent label and bottle. Thin. I'll never pay for one of these again.

Smelled and tasted like a bowl of vegetables. It tasted tart and tangy with a strong aftertaste of spinach.  Tasted a bit of potatoes, brocolli, and corn. Probably goes well with brussel sprouts, but I will never know because I won't be having another one anytime soon.
Yellow generic looking.  Sweet nise.  Too sweet.  Corny?  Boring old generic beer.
An above average beer from the phillipines?  It's true.  San Miguel is good.  Try it and see.
A light bodied easy to drink lager maybe good with spicy food or on a hot summer day.
Golden color, skunky hay aroma, taste like it came from mexico..............
This is one of those shitty lagers you need to eat spicy foods with to mask the taste...on the upper end of the shittiness scale though...not too offensive.  The skunky smell....my god!
Just a 10/20 beer, between a bad beer and a good beer.......................
I thought it was alot like the american beers I usually drink.  just a plain beer.
Smells like a beauty salon. Strange and funky hair product aromas. The palate is cooked and very bland. No malt or hops to found in this brew. My guess would be around 35% to 40% of the mash is rice.

Smells skunky before you even drink it, which is wierd from a brown bottle.  Very malty in flavor, with a light metallic finish.  Not really a dreat beer, but I can see where it might be good for working outside or something similar.  But not really my cup of tea.  Or beer as the case may be.
Decent lager although rather watery.  Once again this is a beer good with a side of encilada sauce.
A borderline decent malt accentuated lager. Some bitterness. Next...........

Another one that is best after going without for a number of weeks.  Gotta be ice cold or don't bother!
Earlier Rating: 3/2/2002 Total Score: 3.5
Probably not as good as my memories of it, but after a few weeks at sea, it is wonderful!

Slight aroma of malt, head is frothy although it is minimal.  Almost clear pour.  Taste is very plain, so much so that it does not differentiate itself from many other middle of the road light lagers.  However, it is crisp and clean thus making it very drinkable.  Overall not too bad.

This is what I feared it would be.  A thin, watery, lame lager.  Growing up in the Philippines, I loved the country, but they can't brew beer to save their lives.  Try the S. Miguel Dark for a better taste!
Has a faint hint of some rotting vegetable in the aroma and the taste isn't much better. Some sips make me flinch and others remind me of nasty beers that I drank in college.
Its not a bad lager, it is safe. Not too strong or too weak. Decent flavor, but not extravagant. I always worry about imports with cliche names, but my fears were subsided.
This beer isn't great at all... I like hamms better.........................

It's actually from the Phillipines... not enough experience to say this has anything in common with pacific island brews but seems to deny much of the regular flaws. not much this light medium bodied lagery brew and not wholly distinct from the dark beyond color.
Not much of an aroma, must be consumed cold. Average dull macro lager except that it is sooo cheap in the PI.
Not really a pilsner, though I did detect some hops there. I did have one once that tasted more hoppy, but generally its bland, and more like a lager. Not much head or body and is fairly forgettable.

according to the label: "A truly satisfying beer" - pale golden colour, few head, no lace, low hop aroma (pilsen ? hum ...), carton-like nose, slightly overcarbonated and oily, flat and boring - Am I satisfied ? Not exactly ...

Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain, cereal), trace hops (herbs), with a light note of DMS. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic, slightly husky. Light to medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation.  Finally tried this again since the first time I tried it, as it was severely infested with DMS. Now it's at least drinkable, but still not pleasantly so.

The only reason I like this beer is that it brings back great memories of my trips to the Philippines and all of those brown skinned hotties I had the pleasure of "getting aquanited" with. Also, it cost about 40 cents a bottle in the PI and won't give you the runs like tap water does.
Pale golden. Medium bodied, some corn- or rice flavour, some bitterness. OK as a tropical lager.

Nothing pilsen-like about it, it's made with "cereal" grains.  Classic light-struck, skunky aroma.  Straw coloured.  Tasted overly sweet and corny.  Of the S.E. Asian beers that I have sampled, this is definitley the worst.  Stick to Thai beer.
